Reviews.Title: “I don't want anyone else to know about my secret spot!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is by far, the best hotel I have have stayed Ina and I have traveled the world. I don't want to say anything else because my lovely oasis will be booked solid forevermore and I will not be able to enjoy the quiet living rooms with the fridge stocked with snacks and ice cream to enjoy in front of the fireplace and read from the library or watch the huge flat screen before retiring to my quiet, plush bed with the wetlands view. Not to mention, the amazing food whipped up in either the bar or lovely dining area. All will be spoiled by me telling you about it because then everyone will know my secret spot to stay when I need peace before boarding an early morning flight and all I hear all night is quiet, no planes or traffic.

Reviews.Title: “eat Haggen Das ice cream while soaking in your large tub filled w/ environmentally-friendly bath crystals!”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel; I can't say enough! I never ever thought I'd recommend someone get married in the SeaTac area, but you should have your wedding here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place--especially with kids”
Reviews.Author: B M
Reviews.Content: Wow, we will certainly stay at Cedarbrook Lodge each and every time we visit Seattle. The rooms were spacious, the bathtub was extra deep, and the whole family enjoyed the free treats in the lounge. We wanted to visit so we invited a family member back to the lodge. The kids took their snacks back to the room and watched the Wizard of Oz while we enjoyed our visit in the floors lounge area. If the weather was warmer we would have loved to explore the grounds more. By the way, breakfast was divine.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place be”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival the shuttle was most timely and the staff were like family. The furnishings were beautiful, blown glass and brass. A fireplace at the bottom of cascading stairs framed by a bank of windows. These windows framed a landscape with flowers and running water which were obviously well thought out, a patio area that was most inviting. Nestled within 8 acres of wetlands, concealed from the grind of the surrounding metropolis, just moments from SEATAC airport. I have lived and worked for many years in the Seattle area and had never discovered this oasis, that is just how good they were at concealing it away from the "Rat Race". A perfect retreat for anyone, very quiet. Professional, top self and just really nice. MagicBob

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Guyfromfaraway
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I can add much more about this place that the other reviews and pictures haven't covered. You would never guess that something this nice and scenic would be found near the airport. This place is simply wonderful, beginning with check-in. I needed to make an appointment for a spa visit and asked for a recommendation. The staff member not only recommended a place, but called the spa for me to make the appointment. Great service from the start. The valet service is reasonable and the staff is friendly. If you have a rental car and a morning flight, you should definitely return your car the night before and take the shuttle to the airport. Very convenient. Things you should know: Because of all the positive and because they also served fresh lox, I can overlook the continental breakfast (I pretty much dined on salmon during my whole trip), but I've had better complimentary (and hot) breakfasts at other hotels. While comfortable for one person, the room was small. Like one other review stated, there is no room for dining in the standard room, but I never used room service or the restaurant for dinner so that wasn't a problem for me. Also, the restaurant only takes reservations for dinner, but I was out during most of my stay so that also didn't bother me. If you have a rental car, it is close to plenty of dining options and other useful attractions. Otherwise, you will likely have to dine in or call a taxi. I booked this place based completely on recent Tripadvisor reviews. I needed a place close to the airport for my last night in Seattle and originally booked a lower rated chain hotel. My plans changed and I needed more nights and figured I might as well look for something nicer and enjoy my stay. I'm very happy with this choice! It was the perfect ending to my time in the Seattle area and close to the attractions I visited on my last couple of days. If I'm ever back in Seattle, I will do my best to stay here again (with a rental car.) :)

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing place”
Reviews.Author: mnrg
Reviews.Content: Came for a quick mini vacation and Cedarbrook is first rate. I highly recommend. The property is beautifully maintained, the staff kind and accomodating without being over bearing. It is quiet and the food is amazing - both in the restaurant and in the "living room" and for breakfast. It is very well priced - a great value!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in an unlikely setting”
Reviews.Author: fiafia
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook lodge lives up to it's promise. It is a wonderfully appointed hotel, with an appropriate breakfast buffet included in the price. The location suited my needs perfectly, but may not fit others if early meetings in downtown Seattle, Bellevue, or Tacoma are on your schedule. The bar menu and that of the Copperleaf Restaurant are good, but perhaps a bit over reaching in terms of trying to be inventive. The staff is helpful and the hotel layout affords privacy when you need/want it. As someone who travels extensively for business, all I can sy is that I wish every destination had a Cedarbrook Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for One Night or Ten”
Reviews.Author: WilderTravel
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, nice amenities, spacious bathroom and bath/shower, awesome continental breakfast, friendly staff, great spring rate of $99/night, nice walkways around the complex, grounds well maintained, shuttle service from/to the airport, free and reliable wi-fi. Oh, did I mention the free malted milk balls (three flavors, the mint are a must!) and the free Haagen-Dazs ice cream? We will definitely keep this on our list of preferred places to stay

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: I was booked at Cedarbrook by my employer. I only got to stay one night, on business, but I will be back with my family. I travel to the Seattle area on a regular basis and this place by far is the nicest place to stay. From the building, to the rooms to the service to the people, I have never had such a great experience. If you are in the Seattle area, I would highly recommend staying at Cedarbrook Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Kootenaygrown
Reviews.Content: Have stayed @ the Cedarbrook Lodge twice. They will not disappoint you. Lovely rooms, great beds, big bathrooms, with large tub, & everything is very clean. The continetal breakfast was scrumptous, as well as the chocolate treats, ice cream, yogurt, chips, and bottled water, they have for your enjoyment in the common areas! The gounds are green, and serene. Top that off with free shuttle to and from the airport, and excellent customer service, Why would you stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: oliviahh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked 2 nights at the Cedarbrook Lodge at the last minute for a family visit to the Seattle area. We wanted a place to uncharge and relax in the evening before spending the rest of our stay with my family. What a great place for accommodation so close to the airport. It is set in a more natural setting away from a busy/main road and you wouldn't even know you are 5 mins from the airport. Our room was solid and modern, clean, up to date with everything, a little on the small side (but not a huge deal at all). The tub in the bathroom was huge which was great for a nice hot bath after spending the day earlier skiing at Crystal Mtn. I'm a big fan of the little things like the bathtub salts and soaps, which were from a quality eco vendor, the bathrobes, ipod alarm clock dock and down comforter. The communal "living rooms" in each lodge that had big sofas and a fireplace along with a huge stock of FREE water, ice cream, fruit, chocolates and yogurt. What a delight!! We got such a great rate too! Service was also very good: the battery on our in room safe was low and wouldn't lock and was promptly fixed. I will DEFINITELY be back at the lodge during my next family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: sgarv1124
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this property for our fifth anniversary although our intent was to spend the day/night in Downtown Seattle. Since we had a car, the drive was no problem. This property has a contemporary, calm, quiet feel. It is well-appointed and has great amenities and we love the lounge area where you can grab a bottle of water or some Haagen-Dazs ice cream to take to the room for the night. Shortly after check-in they brought us a complimentary cheese plate and sparkling water it was a nice touch and will remind us to bring our business back for their attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Complete satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: J N
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property with a great experience. Wouldn't change a thing

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook Sets a New Standard of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: WorkingHorse
Reviews.Content: Expert attention to detail has created a culinary destination that will pamper you with creature comforts, relaxing atmosphere and wonderful hospitality. The menu in the dining room provides an opportunity to experience the incredibly talented culinary team. The emphasis on meticulously sourced local seasonal sustainable ingredients and wines makes this a real Northwest dining experience. Service is a balance of professional, knowledgeable and genuinely warm. The Cedarbrook Lodge happens to be located a few minutes from the Sea Tac airport, but is definitely not an airport hotel. Expect a destination resort experience that surrounds you with a beautiful nature preserve, and leaves you refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet At the Airport”
Reviews.Author: PetersburgSue
Reviews.Content: There is no airport hotel to compare to the Cedarbrook. Hidden in the trees, but a few steps from the airport strip, the Northwest design of the buiding and rooms sends you to a quiet place. The residents' lounge. Imagine lolling on a leather sofa with complimentary ice cream, and fruit, examining the titles in the library. You muse on the merits of travel instead of reverberating with traffic and jet noise. The staff here is what you might expect at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for SeaTac.”
Reviews.Author: MaulersDGII
Reviews.Content: Nice place near SeaTac with a quaint little bar that serve a world class burger.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice and certainly convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: jwjonz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely restaurant the night before flying home from a trip to Vancouver Island. The experience actually added to what had already been a wonderful trip. It's wooded, landscaped setting being so close to the airport really surprised us. Being an avid golfer, had this property included a quality golf course I would consider it more a resort destination than a hotel. We would consider staying here on any trip to Seattle for the beauty of the surroundings, the comfort of the rooms and the quality of the food available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day Special 2012”
Reviews.Author: emmellare
Reviews.Content: we had stayed here before last year, having read a very postive restaurant review. This year another room special appeared, so we came back. Very glad we did, the two bed room was great, the restaurant better than ever. The waiter captain Martinella is a real pro, and Doug the food and beverage manager was very helpful. HIghly recommended.!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal”
Reviews.Author: tnstvlr
Reviews.Content: CedarBrook Lodge is a few steps away from SEA Tac Airport. It is a converted retreat that Washington Mutual (Bank) had very near the Airport. All the rooms are soundproofed and fairly spacious. A low rise facility with 4 separate "lodges" but still interconnected. Each lodge has a small lounge with a TV and snacks - mostly great candy and individual bottles of water - and small Haagen Das ice cream - all complimentary. Service is great and free shuttle to the airport. Valet parking if you want it. I returned my rental car to Enterprise and walked the 6 blocks back to the hotel. The restaurant is fabulous - I will review it under Cedar Brook Restaurant. To die for food and wines. Has only been open for about 3 years. Wonderful place to overnight if you have to fly out the next day or get in late.

Reviews.Title: “In a class all it's own.”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear001
Reviews.Content: First, this is not a hotel, it's a beautiful lodge. Very close to Seattle airport (but you can't tell). The main lodge has a restaurant and separate lounge. The food was very good. This location is peaceful. The room was very clean and comfortable. The little lounge area next to the rooms had complimentary snacks and water (a very nice touch). The only thing I would change is the size of the bed in our room. I'm 6'2, a little to big for the bed. All in all this is a wonderful place to rest and relax. Would stay again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: S H
Reviews.Content: Great location, Very close to airport, but you would never know it. Very quiet setting with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “great for an overnight by the airport”
Reviews.Author: hilaryseattle
Reviews.Content: I was leaving on a very early business flight from seatac and it was my partners birthday the day before. We live almost two hours from the airport and wanted a nice place for birthday dinner. I booked us in and it was a wonderful experience. The food is creative and really well presented, it was during the Holidays and we ate by the big fireplace.. great waitstaff. Our room was very comfortable and the decor was modern and northwest subtle. Very nice bathroom and big fluffy robes. It definitely is a business travellers oasis by the airport. No airplane noise and lovely grounds. You feel like you are miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane709
Reviews.Content: The staff are so friendly and helpful. The ambience at the lodge is more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel. The rooms are large and well laid out for a traveller - lots of space for suitcases and a large workspace if you are travelling on business. The complimentary continental breakfast was great. The grounds look beautiful but as were there in winter, we couldn't really enjoy them. The setting is like a park - you can't believe you are in the middle of a city. We ate in the Copperfield restaurant and it is 5 star - the food was well prepared and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing oasis”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 or 4 times on both business and pleasure. What makes this hotel unique is that you can't imagine how quiet and peaceful it is. and it is less than a stone's throw from SEATAC. The grounds are beautiful; the rooms spartan but comfortable. I think i read somewhere that this was originally a training facility for WAMU and when it went down the drain, it was converted to a hotel. Especially if you are flying out of the airport, skip the hassle of staying downtown and stay here. You will be happy that you did.

Reviews.Title: “cedrarbrook Lodge”
Reviews.Author: georgecarolegross
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Food is creative and well presented. Rooms very nice. Grounds beautiful. It only needs a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, except for the mattress!”
Reviews.Author: 8travelbug
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Cedarbrook. I'm so impressed with this hotel. They really "get it" -- the rooms are small but clean and comfortable and highly functional. The airport drop-off and pick up service are terrific. The staff very well trained and helpful. The only criticism I have is that, at least when we stayed there last week, the mattress was like jello: it moved (and I went flying) every time my husband rolled over. It made for a very restless night, and a tired traveler (me) the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you need to be near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieC
Reviews.Content: You will never know you're near the airport when you see this gem of a hotel! Nestled into a wooded area, it will feel like a lodge in the middle of the mountains. It is a lovely choice if you need to be near the airport. It is very clean, has upscale decor, lovely sheets/bedding, and the rooms are great. Service was also very good. The little lounge area in each building is stocked with goodies: chocolate, chips, crackers, ice cream, string cheese, yogurt. Great to pick up on the way to the airport or before going to bed at night. The only reason I cannot give this resort higher stars is because the mattresses are terrible! They are rock hard, and they wiggle with every movement. This does not make for a very good night's sleep because the hardness makes you toss and turn - and when you toss and turn it makes the entire bed shake terribly (waking the other person in bed!). I definitely expected better mattresses/beds in an upscale place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LostSojourner
Reviews.Content: Not exactly central to the city but if you need an airport hotel that does not feel like one then this is it. Love the free snacks (minted malted milk balls, chocolate covered nuts, ice cream, water), it is also a pretty serene place to sit around and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHerm
Reviews.Content: Head and shoulders above most hotels especially any near SEA.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Fine, Not 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: Let's bring this place back to reality, please. It's a nice hotel, but I think the praise lavished on it might be a bit excessive. The rooms are nice, clean, maybe a bit small, and the bathroom is on the basic side of things. My shower curtain smelled a slightly mildewy, and both the sink faucet and tub faucet were difficult to get to the right temperature and pressure settings - for example, when I turned on the sink faucet, it would start spraying wildly and then I would try to turn it down and it would be a small trickle, and then the smallest nudge would make it spray again. You get the point. I'm just trying to show that these are the kind of fixtures you find at basic hotels - perfectly acceptable, but based on the reviews, you might expect more. And just to give you a sense of the level of the hotel, the only the toiletries in the bathroom are one bath soap, one bottle of lotion, and some bath salts - no shampoo, no conditioner. Again, it's not a big deal, but clearly this is not a high-end hotel. Certainly the grounds are nice, and the freebies in the "living rooms" are really nice - Hagen Dazs ice cream, malted milk balls, string cheese, etc. The breakfast is fine, nothing special, but it's very nice that it's free. Most of all, I just want to say that despite all of the reviews, let's be clear: this place feels like a conference center. If you were here just for a conference, you would not be disappointed. If you were staying here just as a place to rest your head nearby the airport, again, you would not be disappointed. But be careful of the excessive praise that this hotel has received, it's really a pretty basic hotel with some nice freebies thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: N2travels
Reviews.Content: During the recent winter snow storm in Seattle our home lost power for several days. We decided to escape the cold and find someplace close to home. I had heard so many good things about Cedarbrook Lodge and decided to give it a go. What a wonderful experience. Rooms were beautiful and so nicely appointed - even half & half in-room for our coffee! The beds were perfect - not too soft and not too hard. The grounds are beautiful and so serene. We loved the complimentary snack room with bottled water gourmet candy, Haagen daz Ice cream, yogurt, and even string cheese for a quick protein fix. This hotel is located very near to Seatac Airport, but the din of the airport craziness feels miles away at this peaceful hotel. Complimentary breakfast was included - an excellent variety of mostly cold items - with the exception of toasted bagels and oatmeal - which I highly recommend - truly some of the best oatmeal I have tasted. We didn't make it to the restaurant for another meal - but plan to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good - best airport stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Arthmonster
Reviews.Content: Firstly I should say that we have stayed at many airport hotels throughout the world - some adequate and some terrible. This one is fantastic. It has a Scandanavian feel with lots of exposed wood, and that's a good thing! The shuttle from the airport was efficient and we were welcomed at check in with cups of hot apple juice (called cider in the USA although not alcoholic as in the UK!). Our room had a queen bed and a large bathroom with a flat screen 42 inch tv in the bedroom, along with a comfy arm chair. There are lounge areas with free snacks including ice cream, yoghurt, cheese and chocolate treats. It was wonderfully quiet, although a slight niggle was the noise from the heating and aircon system even when turned off - but that is such a minor point in a great hotel. The bed was superbly comfy and the sheets and pillows were of top quality. The robes were a nice touch, much softer than others we've experienced. And a bathtub you can actually lie in - a rarity in the United States. Continental breakfast was fine although nothing to write home about. They have a free shuttle to the Southcenter mall which was useful. They have a good green policy and the menu looked to feature a lot of organic and local produce - something to be applauded. We will certainly stay again and will try to eat in the restaurant - no time on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing atmosphere and great food!”
Reviews.Author: Scargod
Reviews.Content: This is what a hotel should be. The staff is great and amenities abound. The grounds are beautiful and the hotel is located in a quiet residential setting. I felt isolated from the city and only occasionally can you hear the planes at Seatac and even then it is not really objectionable. On site is the Copperleaf Restaurant. I believe the Chef rents the restaurant. Something like that. The food is amazing. Very good wine list, liquor stock and beer selection. I seldom use superlatives or give anything five stars! The hotel and restaurant combo are that good. I played pool in the lounge and the waiter asked me if Credence was OK. He had Pandora on his iphone and linked it into the sound system. He cranked it up and we were rocking out while I played and drank Scuttlebutt, IPA. This is a great place for couples. Rarely are there any children there. The tub was large and we were able to share it. We have stayed here twice and both stays were flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Good atmo, spacious”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: Well, I like this sort of place. It has lots of character, visible wood, scrolly frilly decor, dramatic entrance lobby that makes you feel you've arrived at least somewhere. I didn't have too much chance to explore the neighborhood, but my local host drove me around a bit and pointed out all the great eateries and coffee shops (Seattle is pretty old school; I half-expected to hear poetry and bongos).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Owen R
Reviews.Content: This property was recommended to us by friends. This week due to the snow and ice in Seattle we decided to spend the night there to ensure we made it to the airport in time the next day. The service was incredible especially since they were at 100% occupancy due to the airport closure. Staff were fantastic, tremendous team work with all the senior managers pitching in to help. We ate in the restaurant and the food was really good and reasonably priced. Room was very comfortable and very clean. Nice touch was the complimentary Hagen Das icecream, water, fruit etc. in the lounge area. Absolutely ZERO noise in this property, best sound insulation I have experienced. Cannot recommend this place highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brenthiggins68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this delightful Hotel. Who provide wonderful stay, friendly service and an extraordinary breakfast. The room was beautiful, sunny and clean, and we were made to feel at home at all times. Itâ€™s a breath of fresh air because of the stunning landscape outside with beautiful flowers. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. We look forward to staying there again on our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “If you miss this one, then you miss the best!”
Reviews.Author: snownsun1234
Reviews.Content: We'd go back to Seattle just to stay at this amazing resort again! The smell of the fresh cedar that welcomes you as you enter, is addictive. Everything positive I read on Trip Advisor about this property, was 100% true. Make this resort a holiday stay, not just an overnighter. Thanks staff for an incredible 5 nt stay! 'Angle Lake Neighbourhood Church', 18617 42nd Ave S, SeaTac, WA 98188-5013, is a 5 min walk around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed_Travelers16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cedarbrook Lodge with three of my girlfriends during a shopping trip to Seattle. We couldn't believe how beautiful this hotel was! The room was spacious and very clean. We dined at the resturant the first evening we were there and the food was delicious and the service was great! The "living room" was a great surprise! Yogurt, fruit, water, cheese strings, ice cream and candy bar - Yum! This hotel is a great choice if you want to relax and enjoy a beautiful hotel at a great price. Can't wait to return in May with my hubby!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anthony W
Reviews.Content: Very rarely do you come across a quality hotel so close to an Airport that does not "feel" like its close to the Airport. We arrived in SEA for a 2 night stay while on vacation, was at the hotel within minutes, greeted in a chilly Dec evening with hot cider. Staff were great , rooms really comfortable. Had a terrific meal at the restaurant - suggest however you book in ahead if your going to eat in, getting popular with the locals so we waited till 8 PM to be seated but had a nice couple of glasses in the Lounge prior which was all good. Terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “As Good as Promised”
Reviews.Author: thatguytom11
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and unique hotel experience. It's like staying at Disney's Wilderness Lodge -- but cooler, and especially great for business travelers. Given the price was substantially less than other hotels near the airport that I've frequented, Cedarbrook Lodge was a great value, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: Joie503
Reviews.Content: Wow! we were really surprised! My husband and I arrived on 12/21 and left on 12/26. Such a beautiful place, clean, quiet, and, very peaceful. There's only a few things they need to work on, such as the community refrigerator don't leave your items in there. People steal, we had our Stella Artois stolen and who ever stole it I hope you chocked on it! You're nothing but a common thief!!! Also when were in the bar area one evening, one of the waiters said he couldn't serve us because they were really busy in the dining room. We looked at him like he was crazy! Maybe they had 15 people in the dining area if that. The waiter left and sent in Adam who was so sweet!!!!! he waited on us w/no problem. When we were checking out we voiced our concerns to the manager at the time and it was like talking to a brick wall. He could care less. I've always felt you can't teach customer service, either you have or you don't and it seems Cedarbrook needs to re-think how they hire employees. Oh...one more thing get king size beds.

Reviews.Title: “Want to return to Seattle to stay at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: lisa31jane
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight layover in Seattle recently and after my usual obsessive TA research, booked rooms at Cedar brook for our party of 9. Being an airport hotel, my husband was expecting to roll up at some crummy characterless building, so he was blown away as we approached via a wooded driveway. It was in mid-December so there were many Christmas lights, Christmas trees and fireplaces in the lounges - for 2 families from Australia, this was a dream come true! Our rooms were fantastic - the beds were the most comfortable of our 3 week trip, the bathrooms also fantastic, and the added attraction of free Haagen Daaz in the lounge was a bonus for the 5 kids when we arrived late in the evening. I appreciated the fitness centre greatly as had been sitting on a plane for most of the day. Breakfast for us was rushed as we had to leave for our connecting flight, but was more than adequate. We plan to return to Seattle in 2 years for a proper visit to explore the city itself and think we will stay at the Cedarbrook once again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kye13
Reviews.Content: Came here New Year's Eve. First thing I noticed was how secluded the location was and very pretty! The staff were amazingly friendly and offered us free apple cider! The room was nice and clean along with many eco-friendly products which was definitely a plus. Loved how there were complimentary snacks such as fruits, chips, ice-cream, and bottled water and breakfast the next morning! Although I mostly stayed around Seattle downtown for the day, the hotel is guaranteed worth the drive to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: StefanJ
Reviews.Content: This was really a great place to stay. Quiet and peaceful, still right next to the airport. Breakfast buffet is not of european standard and yes, location is a bit remote from downtown Seattle but itÂ´s a nice drive- anyway. I really liked my time at the lodge and wish to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_in_Port
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with everything about this place - staff friendliness and professionalism, location (near airport but also close to scenic drives). I slept well, ate well and enjoyed myslef. Will definitely be returning here if back in Seattle. The "snacks" provided in the guest lounge area were a very pleasant and welcome surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Gem near Sea-Tac Airport!”
Reviews.Author: uwchou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Xmas night. As a Seattle local, I even don't know there's such a nice hotel in airport area! 1. It's close to the airport. However, when you are in this lodge, you feel like you are on vacation in the mountains! The buildings, garden, and ponds make you feel very relaxed! Guests can take a walk along the pathway. They have shuttle to the airport. If you drive your own car, $12 for self parking, and $15 for valet. 2. Staff are very nice, friendly, and gentle. I arrived around 10pm and planned to wait my friend, who would come later. First, I were attracted by the pretty lightening. Then, right after my car was parked at the entrance, a young man quickly came to my car with warm greetings in such a cold night! I told him I needed to wait to for my friend and he kindly told me several options, such as temporary parking for 10 mins, or doing self parking or valet parking first. He also pointed out the path to walk from parking lot to the registration. 3. The whole property is very eco-friendly. In the public restroom, they provide paper towels and regular towels. Room is low key luxury with nice colors. 2 separate closets are for each guest. Working desk is well designed, good for business trip. Bathroom comes with non-paraben shampoos, conditions, and lotion and exfoliate soap. Overall, room is clean and comfortable. 4. Free bottled water, fruits, chocolate of 3 kinds, yogurt, cheese sticks, and Haagen Dazs ice creme are in the lobby in each building. Free breakfast with quality food. Free hot apple cider in the registration. 5. My friend and I like this place very much and glad that we stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property and experience”
Reviews.Author: christinern
Reviews.Content: Visited in March- very low tourist season. Not many other visitors at this time. Grounds and facility are stunningly beautiful, well manicured grounds and very clean facilities. Room was a bit small, esp. the queen bed. Nice views though. Loved the kitchens and free snacks. Breakfast (free) was a nice way to start the day--- good granola. Looked at the restaurant for dinner, more than we wanted to spend. Very interesting concepts with the different buildings- it felt very chic and classy!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis at SEATTLE Airport”
Reviews.Author: MonkTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was a fun find - the rooms were decent if not a bit small for the one queen bed option. Each cluster of hotel rooms offers a great room stocked with free food and vbeverages little yogurts, cheese sticks, candies and waters. My favorite freebie was the selection of Haagen daz ice cream. Drawback for families - if you have 5 like we do - there are NO connecing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kamaaina808
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is a former conference center that has been transformed into an outstanding hotel with beautiful common areas, nice accommodations, great dining, and everything you need for your business and leisure stay. Rooms are eco-friendly and extremely comfortable and clean. Flat screen televisions, comfortable beds, and quiet wooded surroundings provides a destination-like resort feel at this airport hotel. The staff at the Cedarbrook Lodge go out of their way to provide everything you need during your stay. The workout room is large and well equipped and provides a nice amount of cardio and weightlifting options. Showers and towels are provided and the entire room looks out over the the lush forest like surroundings. Each floor of the hotel has a common area with comfortable furnishings, a fireplace, a flat screen television and complimentary healthy snacks (bottled water, cheese, yogurt, ice cream, etc). Dining options include a nice on-property restaurant which prepares fine meals with an emphasis on local products. A complimentary continental breakfast buffet has a very nice selection of food choices with a nice presentation. The property also has a very nice bar with happy hour prices. Complimentary shuttle service to Seatac Airport and the fixed rail station makes getting around a breeze. What is most impressive about this property is its cleanliness and beautiful setting. You truly feel like you are at a high-end lodge in the forest, even though the property is located just a minute from the airport. Overall, I would highly recommend the Cedarbrook Lodge for your next Seattle visit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bathtub”
Reviews.Author: Miz_Kitty
Reviews.Content: CUSTOMER SERVICE: In the excellent - superior range. No question or request went unanswered. They are happy to take you to, or fetch you from, the nearby SEA-TAC airport or LINK station to downtown. There are a lot of good hotels out there, but only the employees and their service delivery can make for a great hotel. Cedarbrook Lodge is a great hotel. ROOM: Small, but perfectly formed. Very clean and bed was comfortable, I slept really well. The bathroom was roomy and the bathtub was well...amazing. Not your ordinary skimpy hotel bathtub and the shower part of it was pretty darn good too. But even shower people may be tempted to have a bath while staying here. The bathrobes in the room are a nice touch too. GROUNDS: You wouldn't even know you were close to the airport. Grounds were quiet, serene and very pretty - especially as they were decorated for the holidays. AMENITIES: The Living Rooms with TV, fireplaces and plenty of yogurt, fruit, Tim's potato chips, candy and HÃ¤agen-Dazs ice-cream are a stroke of marketing genius. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly Property with All the Amenities”
Reviews.Author: myzapp
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing property! The staff greet you like an old friend when you enter. The main lodge is beautifully decorated, whatever the season. Each wing has an area with snacks, water, fridge, comfy couches and books available for borrowing. The rooms are well designed. The grounds flow around the natural elements in the area. The Cedarbrook is a hidden gem right by the SeaTac airport. Our family (me, DH, DD 16, DS 12 and Australian Cattle Dog Sadie) has stayed at CB several times because we have family in the area. We LOVE this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great for proximity to airport”
Reviews.Author: merc_girl007
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay as I was en route from the UK to Hawaii and needed a hotel close by the airport to sleep for six hours in between flights. The staff were very helpful, room was clean and reasonable size, comfortable bed. The only down side was the food in the restaurant - I had scallops and wine that was recommended by the waiting staff. Both were quite unpleasant. The scallops and wine that is, not the waitress ;) She was charming but misguided in her recommendations. I would definitely go back again though - and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jacob D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a business function and the service was second to none. It was like they knew not just what you needed, but what you wanted before you even thought about it. The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful. The grounds are well maintained, the rooms are comfortable and you can't beat the number of complimentary items. Where else can you pick up free Haagen Dazs ice cream cups on the way back to your room?

Reviews.Title: “You're At Home”
Reviews.Author: Alma G
Reviews.Content: This is my first time experience staying at the lodge. What an incredible secret hideaway! It's quaint and absolutely wonderful place to stay. The staff is great and very friendly. Tim, the waiter, is superb! I love the common areas where you can practically read and help yourself with all the servings of ice cream, yogurt, chocolate balls, chips, and bottled water. I strongly recommend this place if you're ever in Seattle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the fuss / hype”
Reviews.Author: SuperTien
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the reviews and have sent some people here to stay from my company based on TA reviews, now I am staying here for 2 nights for a work trip and I must say this place deserves the reviews - great hotel location, surroundings, service is excellent, living area w bottled water, ice cream, yogurt, fruit, chocolates, and free wifi - really close to SEA with shuttle service to and from, will def reco this place to anyone who comes to SEA for work often and I used to stay at the SEA Marriott every time since it was so close but back then I did not know about this place, there is also a gym on premises also a nice bar with a pool table - nice touch. This place is good by the airport - not as good as the Pan Pacific but that is another a price stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Seatac”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights, partly on business. It is incredibly conveniently located close to Seatac Airport: five minutes away from the airport, and you would hardly know it. It is a sprawling, spacious lodge/resort, with good rooms, comfortable beds, and a quiet environment. The breakfast included in our stay was outstanding â€“ continental but much more than adequate. The fitness centre was one of the best I have used. The natural wood everywhere â€“ panelling, posts and beams â€“ really adds warmth to the dÃ©cor. If you have to stay in Seatac, then it is hard to imagine a better location.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 60sgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before an early flight to Hawaii. The grounds are lovely, and we enjoyed the restaurant, but I had a few problems with the room itself. The bed was beyond hard. I like a firm mattress, but this was like sleeping on concrete. I couldn't sleep at all, which was upsetting since our main reason for staying here was to get a good night's sleep before our flight. Also one of the bedside lights was missing the switch to turn it on. We improvised, but I think a little more attention to maintenance is in order. We did appreciate being able to get into the room before the official check-in time. All of the front desk staff were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook Lodge - much more than an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: 187046Caroline
Reviews.Content: Excellent - the best airport hotel we've ever stayed in. Great staff - the service to and from Seatac and also the Seattle city rail link (40 minutes into the city centre) - nothing is too much trouble. The ice cream and other goodies were a godsend when we arrived at 2am after a long delayed flight. Wish we had made time to try the restaurant as it gets rave reviews - tip, book ahead as it gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a property with bells and whistles!”
Reviews.Author: JPell224
Reviews.Content: When researching where to book, we saw countless fabulous reviews for Cedarbrook Lodge. So much so that we felt there is no way this place can be as great as everyone said, but upon arrival we found out just how great it really is. Everything was amazing. The service, the decor, the rooms...every last detail was handled. In fact, upon arrival we were offered tea. There were snacks available to guests in the common room on the floor we stayed, and much more. The grounds were very well-kept. We were within 5 minutes of SEA TAC but felt a million miles away. Really can't say enough good things about this property. The hype is well-deserved and I would strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: squirrelandalligator
Reviews.Content: If I could live here, I would. The Cedarbrook Lodge is stunningly beautiful - rain or shine. The stff is pleasant and welcoming. The accommodations are clean, well-appointed and the deep soak tub is super fantastic. Bathrobes included! The lodge gives you luxury status without the luxury rates. Amazing. It's been a year since my last visit and I thought the definitely earned another raving review.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: ttandst
Reviews.Content: This was a real surprise. What a terrific lodge. We figured that being so close to SeaTac it would be noisier/busier. We were quite pleased! The room was small, but very comfortable and quiet. The breakfast downstairs in the Lodge was great. We hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “In love”
Reviews.Author: bgibb
Reviews.Content: I know it sounds lame, but I am in love with this hotel. I travel for business 100 days a year and this property is one of my favorites. I am one of those guys who write letters to the management if I have a problem with a hotel. That said, my rule is to also write good reviews when I enjoy uncommon service or quality. Part of me doesn't want to write this review because I don't want to have trouble getting a room in the future, but I also want this property to succeed so I can stay here in the future! I stayed at the Cedarbrook last Summer for 7 nights and am now just finishing up a 8 night stay for a training at a Criminal Justice academy nearby. Why such emotions you ask? Well - it is just blocks from the airport and a mile from the freeway, but you would never know it. I feel like I am in the woods as it is tucked into effective landscaping. The architecture is attractive and rustic. The standard rooms are large and comfortable with big bathrooms and huge tubs. The included breakfast is simple, but fresh and of good quality. Each building in the hotel has a nice little lounge with a fridge full of water, yogurts, string cheese and ice cream. Yep, you read that right. AND there are bins with chocolates for you to enjoy anytime you like. The room service is fast and reasonable, and the food is terrific. Every employee I have come in contact with in my 16 nights here this year has been helpful and pleasant - every single one. Finally, the place is a great value (which I care less about because I don't pay the bills on my business travel, but it does matter). Bottom line, if there were one of these in every city in America I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Downside? It is about a 20 minute drive north to downtown Seattle - a bit of a distance - but you can rent a car from Thrifty a few blocks away for like $30 a day. There is also a light-rail station nearby, and I think their shuttle goes there. Heard enough? Stay here and tell us what YOU think!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Great....and I'm Picky!”
Reviews.Author: Humres32
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my one night stay here. Really enjoyed it! We decided to stay here as we had a fairly early flight back home and we were coming in from Vancouver. The hotel is close to the airport and they have transportation to the airport, if you need it. Our room was like a dorm room but it was nice, clean and fairly roomy. The facility overall is very nice. Our room was not ready when we got there, so we grabbed lunch in the restaurant. The food, and atmosphere, was very nice. We did use the shuttle to get to the train so we could go to the baseball game. The hotel was wonderful to drop us off, then pick us up later. Upon arriving "home" after the baseball game, we were able to help ourselves to little containters of Hagen Daz ice cream. Loved it! We also stopped by the bar in the hotel, which was nice and convenient. The next morning we had a quick breakfast before we left for the airport. The breakfast was nice and it was filling. I would definitely recommend the Cedarbrook Lodge and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis just 5 minutes from Sea-Tac airport!”
Reviews.Author: geekacky
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable this place is nestled amongst the trees and it seems like you are miles away in the mountains! A beautiful lodge with lots of amenities ( free Haagen Daz, malted milk ball candies, etc). Quiet and peaceful, the lodge has an awesome restaurant with a Chef who used to work at The French Laundry! Very good prices for such quality. And to top it off, it's Dog friendly ($50 surcharge). The room service menu even has homemade meals for your pooch! This place rocks it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing Hotel but Staff Could Use a Lesson in Tact”
Reviews.Author: budandlucy
Reviews.Content: As family lives nearby and we are always picking up and dropping off friends and family from Sea-Tac, we always have our overflow guests stay at the Cedarbrook Lodge. After hearing such rave reviews from them, we decided to try it ourselves. I tried to book a studio suite over a month before our stay and everything was booked. So, I booked a regular room. I kept checking back and nothing was available. The day of our stay, I checked and, lo and behold, studio suites are available. I called to change my reservation to a studio suite (which at the AAA rate should have been another $30). The front desk told me it would be a flat $50 fee-no exceptions. So, you block out all these suites; open them the day I am arriving; offer them at a AAA rate; but tell me since I already booked a regular room that I have to pay a flat fee to upgrade? How does that make me want to keep referring people; put up family & friends or personally come back and I haven't even checked in yet? You're not even full that night... Ok...Now we pull up in front to check in at registration. Most parking is coned off so you have to either park hither and yon in self-park ($12 per night) and walk to registration or use valet parking ($15 per night + gratuity) to get out of your vehicle at registration. Being disabled, I asked where the disability parking was located. Valet pointed to 2 spots. I said thanks and started to pull away. He stopped me and said "whoa, you can't park there! Those are reserved valet spots". What?!? So, there is no choice for parking if you are disabled? We discovered later that there are other spots in self park, but they are so far away (2 buildings) that it would be impossible to negotiate that distance. Management really needs to make some sort of allowance and designate those two close disability spots as self park. The valet was so rudely insistent that we get out there that I was absolutely shocked. We checked in without a problem and our room was absolutely spotless and wonderful! Bed was great, room was very comfortable for a basic room. Would love a bigger room next time if I come back. As for amenities, all the friends and family have always raved about the "Living Room" at Cedarbrook. Here's the website description: "Each 500+ square foot residential oasis features a vaulted ceiling, stone-encased gas fireplace, wall of floor-to-ceiling working windows, original artwork, 26" Panasonic flat screen stereo TV with DVD/VHS player, comfy sofa, multiple lounge chairs with ottomans (corduroy or leather, you pick) and shelves of 'library' books. Among refreshment items available daily are bottled waters, individual yogurts, string cheese, ice cream bars and a variety of gourmet malted milk balls, a signature of Cedarbrook Lodge. " Lovely, except there was no string cheese anywhere to be found and all the chips & ice cream they usually have out had been cleaned out by convention people. There is ALWAYS string cheese. Some of us don't want sugar-can't have sugar. Called the front desk. "If there's no chips or string cheese, then we're out." But isn't that part of what you advertise? "Don't you restock?" "Ma'am, whatever is there is what we have left and you'll just have to choose from that." Hey, listen, I'm not trying to be picky, but for what you advertised, from what I know from the 20+ friends and family I have hosted here-there are supposed to be some other selections. Could you just be nicer when I call and inquire? Dinner was absolutely lovely (see my other review of the Copperleaf Restaurant). Overall, this is a wonderful property. However, some of the staff are quite young. Our observation of them, not only with us but with other guests, at the desk found that they had a tendency to be abrupt and a tad condescending. Perhaps they thought they were being professional, it came across as cold and dismissing. If management can warm up the hotel staff and they match the professionalism of the staff of the restaurant-I'll be back. I'm hoping it was just an off night for this place. It was our anniversary and did wish for just a bit more. My rating would have been much higher (room and restaurant were great!) but the staff attitude and indifference really dragged my rating down.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surroundings, Most Helpful Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: HaveANiceStay_11
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge is accurately described on Trip Advisor, so, I really did know what I was getting when I booked it. If you like F. L. Wright's architecture, you will love staying here, where we spent the last three nights of our only trip to Seattle. My husband agreed that I had chosen well. We very much enjoyed much of what Cedarbrook Lodge has to offer, especially the unusual breakfast and the peaceful landscaped surroundings. I appreciated hard boiled eggs rather than what I term "mystery" eggs, so common elsewhere. Since no trays are used in the breakfast room, be prepared to make a few trips around the large room to get the various elements of a good breakfast. We also enjoyed the crab sandwhich lunch a couple of times at their Copperleaf restaurant; it was that good - CRAB, not filler, in a woodsy yet elegant atmosphere. The front desk staff could not have been more accommodating - special thanks to Alice & David, rightfully proud of their hotel, who saw to our getting to and from the light rail station several times during our stay without our own car. They also gave us excellent advice for our time there. Because of their help, we were able to be happy tourists despite being perhaps 15 miles from the heart of Seattle. We are native New Yorkers, so spending about 40 min. on a clean city train (light rail) was not inconvenient, just one more part of a very good vacation. Also, I was glad to be able to keep up with my online scrabble friends at the public PC's.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated as it is really just an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: We did have a nice stay and would consider staying again. The rooms are clean and great bedding. Water at check points no messing around with mini bars, nice. Breakfast was good, not great. We had a tasty dinner in the restaurant. Had some high hopes. Lovely if you face the fire place, the other direction looks a bit like an airplane hanger. Guests and to my horror STAFF going in and out through a door right by our table. Not what you would expect flooding our table and plates with freezing cold air. We wished we had jackets hats and mittens. We thought this can't be happening and there another one would go right on by and freeze the room again. The chef should know as we ate his food COLD, shamefull. Our waiter Tim was very nice to us but I had the feeling they wanted to go home hence the freezing cold air. After dinner we went for a game of snooker in toasty warm bar and we were again "sorry closing" at 10:30pm on Saturday night. Perhaps we should stay a bit more "in town" next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Must visit Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorenia A
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel!! Can"t wait to go back! I loved the snacks specially the chocolate raisins!! Everyone is really friendly. I didn't even want to go out to visit Seattle this time. I just wanted to stay at the hotel and enjoy. This hotel is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: atmktravel
Reviews.Content: I wonder, as others have, why is this place near the Seattle airport and not in town. Although, nearness to the airport makes it ideal to catch a flight. They also provide an airport shuttle service. It is an excellent place to stay with all the amenities; and friendly too. The rooms are very decent. The restaurant serves good food and the bar has good beers. Overall, an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “100% Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoveS12
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this lodge! This was our first trip to Seattle and we chose Cedarbrook based on its reviews here. NOTHING was exaggerated! The views, the staff, the snacks...the entire experience was beyond expectations. We arrived after midnight and even then it was no trouble to call the shuttle to pick us up. We felt so fancy being picked up in Cedarbrook's shuttle when everyone else was being driven away by the traditional nasty hotel buses. Just one of the many details that made the trip wonderful! Long story short, if you are going to Seattle for business or pleasure, pick Cedarbrook. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: GenXbabe
Reviews.Content: I don't know why TripAdvisor loves this place. I selected it based on the high ratings. I was expecting a truly classy hotel but it was average. Checkin service was average- I wasn't greeted by name at any point. I wasn't offered bellhop assistance with my luggage. The room heater didn't seem to be working. The lodge/den was not refreshed with the free snacks so when they were gone, they were gone. The refrigerators were so loud "lounging in the lodge/den" was impossible. My closet had a blood-stained robe in the closet. People speak of the hotel like it's an escape but I could see and hear street traffic when walking between the hotel room to the main building. I had a better stay the previous night at a much cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “O-mazing !!”
Reviews.Author: M_perfekt
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cozy cottage/bed n' breakfast where my friends and I could celebrate my 30th bday in a low key way. Cedarbrook had everything I was looking for AND MORE! The cozy cottage feel i was looking for with all the modern touches a girl needs. The staff was so NICE and SUPER sweet, you could tell everyone enjoyed working there, from the front desk to housekeeping, everyone had a genuine smile on their face, which made our stay even better. We were allowed to check-in a bit early and received a room which overlooked the wetlands. For each area there is a "living room" with nice oversized chairs, fireplace, and SNACKS! My friends were elated when they saw the Haagen Das ice cream (and greek yoghurt). I'm constantly eating so the complimentary fruit, chips, and water were definitely welcomed as well as the extra space in the refridgerator for food and the microwave. Breakfast in the morning was yum especially the organic tea and Apple cider. Bad breakfast is a deal breaker for me, but Cedarbrook came through with scrumptious bagels, 7 grain toast, fresh figs and much more. We came at the start of low season so parking was abundant and FREE! During high season it can be a different story. They also have a complimentary 24 hr shuttle which will take you to the rail station or airport. The driver gives you a card to give them a ring when you're back at the station. We had a rental but used the shuttle the day we went sightseeing and used the rail. The driver was prompt and courteous and let us know it was 24 hrs and how to contact her. We called for a pickup later that night around 1030 while we were still on the train and were told to call back when we were actually at the rail. We did not like the idea of 3 young ladies at the platform at night so we called when we were two stops away and the shuttle was waiting for us and a few others (the distance from the lodge to the station is less than 4 mins, tack on an extra 4 to get to the airport). The Lodge felt very safe and secure even when we came traipsing in after midnight. We did have technical difficulties with the hot water in the shower but that was remedied immediatley. All and all we had an O-mazing stay at Cedarbrook.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfan96
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has everything you want for a comfortable stay. Situated in the middle of a sub-division but surrounded by so many trees, shrubs and gardens you feel like you're in the middle of nowhere. Comfortable rooms and beds, friendly common room with unlimited treats, water, yogurt , and ice cream. Small piano bar with fun staff, local wine and beer, and a delicious breakfast in the dining room. What else can I say we loved the place

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was hoping to experience!”
Reviews.Author: Discriminatingguest6
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a friendly scale property with genuinely engaged staff and a fabulous restaurant, stop searching and book here. Where else will you also find a wonderful complimentary breakfast and free first quality snacks in a common "living room"? The restaurant is top notch and well worth the price. I hope to stay at this hotelier's other properties soon. My stay exceeded my expectations. BOOK NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Starbucks Coffee in your room :)”
Reviews.Author: marclaudi
Reviews.Content: The best way to start your day... good coffee in your room, the lounges with snacks including Haagen-dasz ice cream... I had no problems with breakfast. They have good bagels :) In general food was great. They have excellent service and shuttles to the airport, which is just 5 minutes away. The rooms are really comfy and clean. I loved staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful site, easy access to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: winterfe5
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is a gorgeous site with great amenities and a wonderful restaurant. It is close to the airport and provided easy access to downtown Seattle. I look forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelKings49
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - one of the best we have stayed in - but with one big reservation - breakfast which was very disappointing. What's with Cheerios for breakfast? Surely a more "adult" cereal could also be provided for those who don't enjoy sweet breakfast cereal. Another gripe we have is that the only fruit choice was a variety of melons. My husband detests melon so he had no fruit. So that left toast and fruit juice basically. For a hotel of the calibre of Cedarbrook with so many rave reviews a little more attention should be paid to the quality of the breakfast. Other than breakfast we really enjoyed our stay and had a lovely meal in the bar. We also liked the idea of a lounge area with 24 hour snacks. We're hoping to come back again next June for a couple of nights. Any chance breakfast could be improved on by then?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambience”
Reviews.Author: sahakp
Reviews.Content: You'd never know you were five minutes from Sea-Tac airport. It feels very peaceful and secluded, with acres of lovely grounds. Rooms are beautiful, and beds are extremely comfortable. There's a central living room for guests, stocked with a variety of snacks. Wonderful breakfast included in the room rate. I wish I could have stayed for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stay outside the city”
Reviews.Author: Destination360
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect when staying here, but were pleasantly surprised with just how wonderful the hotel is, especially given how close it is to the airport. Great rooms, nice pool, wonderful grounds, and a terrific staff. The only caution we'd have is you are about 15 miles outside the city, and the traffic can be rough in the Seattle area. If you're looking for a relaxing getaway, Cedarbrook is perfect. If you're looking for a vacation with more access to the city, it might not be right for you.

Reviews.Title: “good place, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MosEkaterina
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean, quiet and roomy. 20-25 mins from Seattle center by car; good place to rest or take a couple of days off.

Reviews.Title: “So many surprises!”
Reviews.Author: BearFan1
Reviews.Content: We expected to enjoy Cedarbrook Lodge based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. After a long flight a way too many complications in getting here, it was so nice to check in and relax. The property is tucked into a residential area, and was not the easiest to find, thanks to our GPS. Check-in was fast and friendly. The restaurant was full for the night, and since we were tired, we decided to just eat at the bar. Our server was attentive and helpful with food and beer suggestions. The crabcake sandwich was excellent, mostly crab and very little filler. As it should be! We also had an Heirloom tomato salad that was small, but very flavorful. The beer list was very good. We wandered around the grounds in the rain, made much more comfortable by the umbrellas at every door! They have Haagen Dazs ice cream in the lounge for guests, a nice little touch. The rooms are huge and unbelievable comfortable. The decor is as Pacific Northwest as it gets. Complimentary continental breakfast in the morning was fantastic. Again, only top notch food: smoked salmon for the bagels, and lots of toppings for fresh oatmeal. The grounds are beautiful. The only drawback to the location of the hotel is the distance into Seattle itself. It is very convenient to Sea-Tac, but a long ride into the city. If you want to see Seattle, I would recommend staying downtown. For a relaxing weekend or a luxury room near the airport, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelogueGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in October at the end of our West Coast US Tour. Initially we couldn't decide whether to stay in town or elsewhere. Checked out Trip Advisor for options. Looked at Inn on the Market. However they only had city view rooms available and a bit pricier than other options. We managed to get a discounted price on the Cedarbrook through Hotels.com. Cedarbrook it easy to get to, just off the I5 and close to the Airport. Place looks great not the standard airport hotel. Set in trees and nice grounds. Reception was very good, quick and easy. Booked the restaurant on arrival. Room was very good. Very clean, bright, comfortable with a view over the gardens. Had a nice feel to it. Bathroom was a very good size with large bath, in fact this was the first time I've had a bath in years. There was no fridge or minibar however there was a lounge area where you could get free water, yogurts, chocolate and Haagen Das Ice Cream!! Restaurant was a bit pricey but we enjoyed our meal and the staff were very attentive. A little bit Nouveau Cuisine for my liking but very tasty. I had the Salmon and my wife had lamb. Overall a worthwhile experience. I would recommend at least one visit to the restaurant on your visit. For those on a budget there are cheaper options in the bar. Burgers etc. Breakfast was good quality, usual US fare except the fancy tea bags and the smoked Salmon. That was nice. They charge for parking, $12 per night for self parking and a bit more for valet parking. I felt they shouldn't be charging for parking however we got such a good rate on the room I didn't begrudge paying a few dollars for this. Most people will arrive depart using the shuttle anyway. The shuttle was available to take guests to the airport. We used it to go to the light rail station and then into town. Light Rail is the way to go. Day pass was just over $5. We had a walk through the grounds, there is a kitchen garden where the chef can get his veg and herbs. There is a business centre where I printed out our boarding cards for the flight home. Overall we were more than happy with our stay at the Cedarbrook and would highly recommend a stay here whether you are on Business or Pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise near SEA-TAC”
Reviews.Author: Bythebay11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cedarbrook for business recently. I was so suprised to find this gem accomodation so tucked away in the beautiful setting right next to SEA-TAC airport. Nice ammenities to welcome you and the decor is really modern and cozy. I will not hesitate to stay here again when I am traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DixieNetherlands
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and we didn't regret it. It looks wonderful from the outside, inside is even better. The rooms are amazing. Spotless clean, very comfortable beds, enough space to move around. The fitness room was great. There is a living room in each block with a kitchen where you can get free water, yoghurt, icecream, chocolate balls, crisps. Great service! The restaurant is small, but the food is very good and they have an amazing chef. He uses fresh ingredients and everything tasted great. They have a great selection of wines. Staff was very friendly. The shuttle service the hotel offers is very handy. We used it every day to bring us to the Light Rail. It is a 30 minute ride to the center of Seattle. The ticketmachine didn't read our European Mastercard so you may need cash money. A dayticket costs only $ 5,50. You cannot park your car for that price. If ever we come back to Seattle we will certainly stay in this hotel, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sooz2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4-night stay at Cedarbrook. I agree with reviews concerning most things, and a few I felt were overrated but still very OK. (When a hotel is so highly rated, it's hard to not have ridiculously high expectations.) The grounds alone would be reason to stay there; they are gorgeous, and lush, and manicured and tucked away in a quiet area. The room was spotlessly clean, the beds very comfortable with beautiful linens, the decor lovely although not luxurious. The bathroom was fantastic, and the soaps the best ever! The snacks available 24/7 that everyone refers to were great fun, and I ate too many 'chocolate malt balls'. It was extremely nice to have bottled water (although we ourselves have stopped using plastic non-refillable ones for environmental reasons, and this bothered me a bit) One of the highlights was the really wonderful continental breakfast that went beyond the usual. GREAT FRUIT, granola, and oatmeal with toppings galore ... a real treat. And smoked salmon! It is served in a gorgeous dining room (so unlike many other hotels), with large round tables and floor to ceiling windows to the beautiful grounds. We drove, so parking was a bit of a problem ... not enough of it. This was prior to a charge for parking so perhaps that will improve the situation. The room price was fair, the stay fantastic, and any complaints are so minor that the only reason I mention them at all is to try to keep expectations realistic. I REALLY want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: g8edcowgirl
Reviews.Content: What a little gem of a hotel. We've stayed in beautiful places all over the world and this place is as luxurious and comfortable as any of them at 1/2 the price at least. Cedarbrook will always be our place to stay when visiting Seattle. The restaurant in the hotel was fantastic too! Great wine, good food, very attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Just as it's rated -- excellent (and not a typical airport hotel)”
Reviews.Author: Isle-to-Isle
Reviews.Content: We live near Seattle, but decided to minimize the stress of an early morning international flight by staying at SeaTac. All the reviews are so right â€“ this is a wonderful hotel, and definitely the best airport hotel experience Iâ€™ve ever had! The rooms are not huge, but theyâ€™re very stylish and comfortable, and most important -- the overall facility is sooo relaxing and retreat-like, with fun little nooks where you can help yourself to free ice cream, yogurt and candies, not to mention a really wonderful restaurant with terrific local farm fresh food (the chef is gaining quite the reputation!) Since we live in the area, we would actually venture back to the hotel just for a great meal! Our only regret was that we arrived in the dark and left in the dark, so didnâ€™t get to appreciate the grounds/exterior. Oh, and we regret we couldnâ€™t have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Seattle location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet, in a beautifully landscaped surroundings. Our interest was in downtown Seattle and the hotel provides free transport to the airport from where there is a quick train connection to the city. The only fault we found was that the complimentary breakfast was not up to the standards of the otherwise first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem close to Sea Tac!”
Reviews.Author: Diane K
Reviews.Content: I always check Trip Advisor's ratings before I book a hotel where I am unfamiliar with the area. I am never disappointed and trust the reviews. The Cedarbrook was hidden in a residential area even our friends from Seattle didn't know about and they travel in and out of Sea Tac frequently. They had recently seen an article reviewing the Copperleaf restaurant and were anxious to try it. We surprised them when I said I had booked it for the night before we departed because of the reviews and proximity to the airport. They joined us for dinner and we were all impressed by the quality of the food and ambiance. They most certainly will return and we will stay again when we return for a visit. It had the feeling of a corporate retreat with all the thoughtful amenities one would love at a high end resort. They even have food treats like Haagen Dazs Ice Cream that are complimentary in the living room areas of each bldg. This would be wonderful for a family reunion or extended family gathering place for a wedding type of event. Really delightful!!! No wonder it was rated #1 !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: gretel_nj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just minutes from the Sea-Tac airport, although you wouldn't know it when you stay there. The decor is terrific; the fitness center is very good, and they offer free bottled water, yoghurt, Haagen Das ice cream, fruit and malted milk balls at any time of day. The continental breakfast included fresh fruit and smoked salmon, but one day we didn't get there till close to 9:30 (when it ends) and they were completely out of muffins and bagels. (: Some cons: no fridge in the room and there is now a fee (~$12 a day) for parking (although this is less than you pay if you stay downtown). If you can, take the shuttle from the airport and pick up your rental car when you are ready to move on. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from the Link light rail station which is very convenient for getting into downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE even if your purpose is 30 miles away”
Reviews.Author: SafetyHarbor
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook is a rare jem . The property was built by a large Bank around 2002 as a Corporate retreat and training center. It has all the trimmings one would imagine a Bank spending on themselves. There is a bar area substantial Restaurant, good breakfast, substantial parking, Airport Shuttle, friendly staff , well manicured gardens that totally obscure everything else and is only two blocks from the Airport and the freeway. I have stayed in hotels around the corner on the Golden mile of Airport Hotels and they are nasty. This property is almost a destination in itself, with lounge areas in each wing of accommodation with library, snack food, gymnasium. The property is built around the post and rail beam system and has an abundance of timber finishes throughout the public areas and the rooms. I cannot say enough about the whole package. If Seattle is where you need to be, then this is the place to stay. There is nothing that comes close ............. at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Mike200284129
Reviews.Content: Lots of things to do in Seattle.....but if you don't sleep well, it might not be as much fun! Well, CedarBrook Lodge gave us a great night of sleep, was close to Sea Tac, between Tacoma and Seattle and it is a secluded get-a-way in the middle of everything. We drove up to Seattle and did the seashore thing, went up on the Needle, then took a drive (Ferry Ride) across the bay to see Gig Harbor and Bremerton.....and all the way back to Cedarlodge. A good day of seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom1122
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel are right on. This hotel is quiet, clean and the staff is very helpful. I had read reviews stating the hotel's complimentary snacks included Haagen-Dazs, but I wasn't really expecting that to be the case. I was wrong! This hotel provides complimentary snacks well above what most hotels provide. I booked online through expedia and received a lower rate than offered on the hotel's website. This is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close but not to close to SeaTac.”
Reviews.Author: Quint B
Reviews.Content: Great front desk folks and hotel it self is beautiful. Will come back with family.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETELY COMFORTABLE!”
Reviews.Author: 1Clayton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September 2011 for 1 full week during a very special, milestone anniversary and enjoyed all that the Cedarbrook Lodge had to offer. Thank you so much Scott. Many of the Employee's do a terrific job. *** Special thanks go out to David and Kayausha for their wonderful assistance, kindness and putting in the extra effort with our requests at the desk. They both drove us in the van as well. A big thank you also goes out to Maria who takes such good care of the Guests at breakfast. She is amazingly organized and pleasant. On the 2 days that she was off, we really missed her. When in Seattle again, the Cedarbrook Lodge will be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “As good as rated in TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is as good as rated in Trip Advisor. The Lodge is located on a quiet and peaceful wooded property within a mile of SEATAC airport and is a good value. My honey and I stayed in a huge suite and loved the quality of the room. A nice touch is the high quality snacks that are located in each building that included Haagen-Dazs ice cream. I made the reservation online at the Lodgeâ€™s website and took advantage of the prepaid discounted rate. The included breakfast was first class with oatmeal and fresh fruit in addition to regular breakfast fare. The only downside is the new charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: NickF55555
Reviews.Content: Really trusted tripadvisor rating, we weren't disappointed. Excellent rooms, well kept grounds, very good restaurant, complimentary breakfast, WiFi, & snacks. Easy access to light rail system & to airport, with complimentary van service to each. They make other hotels look second rate with all their service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain65
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Loved the gathering places. This would be an excellent place for families to stay for a reunion or wedding. I felt the staff was extremely friendly. Breakfast was good. Rooms were nice. Loved the facial soap provided. I'm trying to find out how to buy some. I gave this a very good vs an excellent rating for two reasons. The mattress in our room was horrible. It was sagging so bad toward the center, I felt like I was sleeping on a hill. My back was bothering me each morning. The other problem was the sudden charge for parking. I was trying to choose between 2 hotels in this area. Decided on Cedarbrook because it sounded like a real nice place to stay. I noticed on the website that the price didn't include parking. I called the hotel to ask about parking. She said they don't charge for parking, but put the disclaimer on the website "just in case". Kinda funny that they just started to charge for parking the day we arrive. Almost seeems to me that they pick and choose when they are going to charge for parking. Perhaps when there's a big conference? I was not happy about the additional charge per day. Had I known that ahead of time, I may have picked the other hotel. It also had good reviews and was cheaper per day. And it was closer to the place we were going.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hidden get-away!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuginarug
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate the day before our "get-away" weekend and will be back again! Beautiful serene gem of lodge. Played Bocce ball, lawn croquet, pool and walked the lush, peaceful grounds. The Haggen-Daz was a delightful addition!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel!”
Reviews.Author: cmalson
Reviews.Content: We booked an overnight stay as a stop on our way home from an Alaskan adventure. As we were driving in, we were immediately taken with the surroundings.
