The staff, food and accommodations are all excellent. Breakfast was nice, the family room with ice, snacks and treats was a welcome surprise.

Reviews.Title: “I never slept better!”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen636
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Cedarbrook Lodge while on vacation. The service was excellent. The convenience of the location was great. The BEDS, pillows and duvets in the rooms were incredible. The daily breakfasts were delicious and always so fresh. The staff was acommodating and friendly. Will highly recommend to others. We will have wonderful memories of Seattle and Cedarbrook.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding ambience, service and food.”
Reviews.Author: signedup
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and will return any time we are in the area. The hotel is like an oasis in the middle of the city ... calm, relaxing and tranquil. The staff are supberb, the food excellent and the rooms very clean, well maintained and comfortable. It feels like a resort. There are quite a few extra's ... transportation to and from the airport, LRT and shopping mall; a lounge in each building with a fireplace and library and food bar area with complimentary bottle water, ice-cream, yogurt, chocolate, chips, fruit. A great place to escape the city.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: EdwardSandiego_CA
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge is located close to Seatac Airport. You would never dream it is an airport hotel, as it is a few blocks away from Seatac Airport next to a wetlands area. Cedarbrook Lodge was originally the conference training center for Washington Mutual Bank. It is ideal for business travels and corporate conferences. Cedarbrook also welcomes individual travelers that want a quiet, restful place to stay. Very nice restaurant, bar and breakfast area. Nice walking paths for a twenty minute morning or evening walk with a few loops around the beautifully landscapes grounds. Benches are located around the grounds for reading and relaxing. Staff is excellent and friendly. The Lodge has a computer center for those that want to use the internet. Highly recommend as a place to stay. I choice the discounted "Green Program" of four days or more. Linens and bath towels changed every four days like you would at home. I believe most rooms are queen beds, but very comfortable, and each suite with it's own climate control and black out curtains for sleeping. Enjoyed the stay and will return to Cedarbrook Lodge upon our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: Olu T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and comfortable and clean. It had nice lil perks, a 24-hr lounge with, water, yogurt, fruits and some chocolate, all free!!! My problem was with the reception staff, while they were not overtly rude, but for the caliber of the hotel, they were not friendly. Seemed like they were always too busy to attend to clients and were not warm.. I would have also liked more breakfast options. But i will def return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb. Well worthy of its high ranking”
Reviews.Author: FABIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. OK it is a little pricey compared to others locally. But having said that we chose the Doubletree a couple of weeks later and whilst we saved a small amount the service was awful. Fabulous personal service beginning with the airport pick-up. Lovely room and the common areas are fantastic. Really peaceful location despite its close proximity to the airport. Good breakfast choices and the bar area is very welcoming with great wine and food selections. Another plus is the drop off and pick up at the Light Rail station. Overall I would rank it as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Canuck27
Reviews.Content: We found a beautiful Gem in Seattle, actually in Sea/Tac. Just blocks from Sea/Tac airport found inside a neighborhood. Very well maintained lodge with large rooms. The staff is very proffessional and everybody is friendly. Free snacks in the Commmunity rooms (Ice cream, string cheese, water, chocolate covered raisins, yogurt etc) No parking fees like you find everywhere in Seattle but your only 15-20 minutes to downtown. If you want to feel like your are staying at resort but still close to all of the Seattle area has to offer Cedarbrook Lodge is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem by SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: RDBAz
Reviews.Content: I have now stated at the Cedarbrook Lodge five times in the last year while in Seattle for business. This hotel was formally the conference center for Washington Mutual, so it has a lot of great business features. It is surprisingly quiet even though it is just a few minutes from the airport. You do not feel like you are in the middle of an urban area, is there are some wetlands adjacent to the property. The hotel is just minutes from Interstate 5, so you can be in downtown Seattle or downtown Tacoma quickly. Even better, there is a light rail station just a few minutes a way that will take you to downtown Seattle in about 20 min. The Copper Leaf restaurant is a small, intimate room with outstanding food. The hotel has a continental breakfast, and free snacks including HÃ¤agen-Dazs ice cream. I am not sure what more you could ask for in a business hotel. My wife has also stayed there when traveling alone, and has been treated exceptionally and feels very secure on the property. This is our "go to" place when traveling to the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “It's a pity this gem is by the airport....”
Reviews.Author: OverThereOverThere
Reviews.Content: It's a pity this gem is by the airport, but i wont hold that against Cedarbrook. But Downtown Seattle is pretty steep in price so if you are looking to stay by the airport to save or you just gotta catch a flight, this is the place to hunker down in. Excellent stay. Free snacks and water, absolutely incredible. Room service is okay, though I wouldn't recommend dinner. For a snack, however, go for it. The really thick Hot chocolate is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel295
Reviews.Content: Found this really nice lodge/hotel near Sea-Tac Airport. We shared room with the other couple (2 beds). Bathroom was really clean, room was very reasonable size. I definitely loved the bed and pillow. It was so comfortable we took naps everyday. The hotel provides daily continental breakfast which was delicious. Fresh bagels and bread everyday with fresh fruits. Oatmeals, cereal, and also fresh smoked salmon. I made myself smoked salmon bagel every morning along with my world famous starbucks coffee. Yum! The hotel lobby/rest area also provides bottled water, chips, yogurt, string cheese, and wait for it... Haagan daz ice cream!!!!! What's there not to like about this hotel? Free hotel parking, free snacks, and free breakfast. The hotel is like 5 mins away from the airport, about 15-20 mins from downtown Seattle. I would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelskeeker
Reviews.Content: I have been to Seattle many times, but this was the first time to stay at this hotel. It was a great place to stay. We came here for a family wedding and will return to this hotel everytime from now on! Only wish there was something like this in Portland.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideAsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before flying out the next day. The hotel was great. Free snacks, nice views, free airport shuttle, great food. Only downside is the distance to downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, even with being close to the airport, very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: rgulli
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Dreamin Dogwoods suite. Very spacious and wonderful with full windows on two sides. Fireplace, however not used. Said it had a "wetlands" view, however mainly just bushes, wetlands were on the other side of bushes and walking path. Property is very well maintained and clean. Very quiet, however almost too much so.. Had to venture out if you wanted other options for dining and entertainment and no guidance offered. The only disappointment and an inconvenience was no WiFi access for Tablets from your room. For a property that caters to the business client hard to believe that they know about it and not upgrading systems.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spacious rooms in a garden setting!”
Reviews.Author: Anne885
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Cedarbrook Lodge. We had an open day before our fight home and wanted a hotel near the airport. To our surprise, the hotel had a country club feel rather than the typical airport feel. Our room was beautifully appointed, clean and spacious. The grounds are beautiful with flowers, patios, and a pond. The restaurant is lovely and the food delicious. Also, the airport van driver was punctual and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Dan J
Reviews.Content: Hotel was your typical average hotel, Wifi, lounge, free breakfast, etc.... NOT in a good location. Not close to civilization and just out in the wilderness. I will be back again but i will remember to bring everting i need because their are no stores up their. Nice decor and amazing staff. Clean and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport and far away from civilization”
Reviews.Author: Slobass
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews here and I wasn't disappointed. It's really a gorgeous lodge and could be a nice little spot to get away from it all. The campus is spread out and a bit awkward when arriving late at night, but the staff was very attentive and friendly. My only complaint was with the issues I had with their wifi connection, but the front desk gave me an ethernet cable and I was good to go. Regrettably, I did not sample the food at Cedarbrook but the menu looked enticing. I did gorge myself on the free cheese sticks, chips, ice cream and water in the lounge area. The free breakfast didn't look appealing to me, but I may have been overwhelmed by the large crowd of people sitting in the hall eating. Suffice it to say this was a pleasant stay and I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBader
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge was a wonderful final night stay following our Alaskan cruise. Our rooms were ready at check in. Everything was nice and clean. My family enjoyed the living rooms and the 24 hour complimentary snacks. Pickup from the airport was prompt and we made additional use of their shuttle to the light rail. We all enjoyed the beautiful grounds in the morning prior to leaving for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Lodging Secret in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place to stay. They thought of everything - beautiful setting, comfortable well-appointed rooms, delicious food, courteous and helpful staff. We were totally impressed. It's hard to imagine that a lodging experience would be a highlight of your trip to Seattle, but Cedarbrook definitely made it so!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, luxurious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn L
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Cedarbrook Lodge and wished we could have stayed longer! The entire facility- including our room- was VERY clean and beautifully landscaped/decorated. We had a room with two queen beds, which were very clean with beautiful linens and four pillows each! We enjoyed complimentary Haagen Dazs ice cream, candy and water from the snack fridge. We also really loved the oversized bathtub for a nice relaxing soak. The complimentary continental breakfast was wonderful- coffee, juice, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and more! We did not get a chance to try the restaurant but the menu looked amazing! We did have time to walk all around the grounds and loved the waterfalls, ponds, beautiful shrubs and flowers and rolling lawns. We would definitely return! The Cedarbrook Lodge is literally 2 minutes from SeaTac airport- so convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, love the snacks!”
Reviews.Author: MarissaNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed just this last week. This hotel does not feel like it is near an airport, you drive through a little neighborhood and there you are. You can see and hear the planes taking off but it seems pretty unobtrusive. The little living rooms with all the snacks are a wonderful perk. The fitness center is also very nice and well supplied. The rooms did not seem at all dated to me, as another reviewer said. The grounds are very nice, but like another said, there really aren't walking trails so much as a short path surrounding the lawn. We also had a wedding both nights we were there, which certainly cuts back on where you are allowed to sit, the outdoor area for their restaurant was off limits so you had to eat inside. I could see that being a bit annoying. It didn't particularly bother us though. Breakfast was great, I had smoked salmon every day! The "green" aspect of this place is really nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! & Customer Focused”
Reviews.Author: Passion4Travel4Life
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook Lodge takes you back to a time when businesses truly put EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE first! Courtesy shuttle service from/to airport & link light rail. Front desk is very POLITE and offers a delicious cup of iced tea upon arrival. The hotel & all its amenities are VERY CLEAN! The grounds are BEAUTIFUL...Lush & Green! Perfect for weddings...which we were able to see 2 of. The beds are sooo COMFORTABLE! The rooms are quaint & intimate but spacious. If you desire more space opt for the Deluxe Double Queen. The bathrooms have HUGE tubs that are great for RELAXING and large vanities! The windows are large with SERENE VIEWS and separate blackout shades make a late sleep-in possible. The best surprise was the common lounge area on each floor that provides guests with FREE bottled water, a variety of sweets, fruit, chips, yogurt, & ice-cream. Lounge also has library. The food available through room service or in the dining area was very tasty. My friends raved about the bacon cheeseburger. BEST VALUE for the PRICE!!! We are a group of 6 (3 couples) who take @ least one trip a year together & it was UNANIMOUS...we loved Cedarbrook Lodge and it is now our hotel of choice when we return to Seattle! Cedarbrook Lodge take a bow for a JOB WELL DONE!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ALRAINE
Reviews.Content: There are just not enough good things to say about this place!! My husband and I went on a yearly trip with some friends of ours over Labor Day weekend and all of us were impressed. I wanted to stay in the city and was slightly bummed that we wouldn't be, but this place made up for it tenfold! We had a late flight and checked in around 1:00 in the morning, and even at that late hour, the hospitality was phenomenal. The hotel is very eco-friendly, the grounds were immaculate, the rooms were tastefully decorated and clean, the staff was all terrific and helpful. There is even a sitting area that offers 24-hour complimentary snacks that include Haagen Dazs ice cream (one of my husband's highlights)! The only thing I wished it offered was a spa service. Overall, our stay was absolutely fantastic and it will be a given that we stay at this facility again if travel takes us back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but some cautions”
Reviews.Author: ellenmToronto
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here one night on a layover from China to Canada. I picked this hotel over less expensive airport hotels because of the reviews which talked about the beautiful grounds. Well, they are beautiful but we were essentially not allowed to use them the afternoon/evening we were there as they were rented out to a wedding. As this was the whole point of choosing this hotel, I felt I certainly did not get my money's worth. It is a beautiful setting although the hotel rooms themselves are starting to become dated- arm chair in the room stained, tear in the blanket etc. Additionally, perhaps due to the wedding, we were put in an wheelchair accessible room. This meant we did not have a bathtub and the shower was only a hand held. As is usually the case, hand held showers give much less pressure. The shower was also a roll in with a shower curtain that did not reach the floor. As a result, it is very easy to end up with water all over the floor, especially if you have children. Not very relaxing after 15 hours on airplanes. Over all I felt as though we were not valued as clients. The benefits went to the wedding party. If that is the hotel's priority, fine, but they need to tell potential guests that parts of the facilities will be off limits and they may end up with a room with poor bathroom facilities. I did ask to speak to a manager right away only to be told that none is available on weekends. The solution was to give me a card with his name and contact information and to suggest I get in touch with him on Monday. That is just not the service level I expect at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Joan790
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we knew we were in a very special place. From the "quintessential" Northwest architecture, beautifully landscaped grounds, original art work, massive glass windows overlooking towering evergreens - we felt we were in the most restful, restorative place. Our trip included two family reunions and reunions with friends. Cedarbrook Lodge gave us a peaceful, restorative oasis from our hectic, hyper schedule. We looked forward to coming "home" to Cedarbrook each night and will return everytime we're in Seattle. Thank you for providing the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook thinks of everything!”
Reviews.Author: TeacherLaur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise to Alaska. We were tired and wanted a place where we could stay and enjoy Seattle while having access to the airport without a car. Cedarbrook is an amazing place. We were picked up at the Sea-Tac airport light rail stop Saturday morning by one of their drivers. We were allowed to check in before noon. We were amazed how relaxing and gorgeous Cedarbrook was! We loved the food & service at The Copperleaf Restaurant where we ate lunch and dinner. All of my food allergies were taken care of safely. All the extras like storing our luggage, giving us a hotel key for access to the lobby and snacks until our late evening flight, beautiful grounds, shuttle service. Perfect place to relax and stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: JUDYKEGS
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were picked up at the airport we were treated great. The shuttle driver asked if we had reservations for transporation to the cruise terminal and made all the arrangements for us. We arrived at 11:00am and expected to wait for our room since check-in time was 4:00pm, but they checked us in and then the shuttle took us to the light rail to go downtown for the afternoon. The grounds at Cedarbrook were beatiful and relaxing. We ordered room service that evening and the food was excellent. We really enjoyed the snacks that Cedarbrook provides free of charge (yogurt, cheese, fruit, ice cream, candy, chips, and bottled water). I would definitely stay at Cedarbrook again and would give this hotel six stars if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PPPMaryland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and huge room and bathroom with nice "green" amenities. Best hotel breakfast ever, it even included salmon the day we were there. Wish we could have stayed longer to hang out and eat the malted milk balls that are provided. You do not feel like you are staying at an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dlw329
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Cedarbrook Lodge 8/27-9/3/2011. It was a wonderful week! The place is beautiful, the people friendly and helpful and special touches you would not expect. Each building has a "library" room with comfy couches, wall mounted tv and snack area stocked with 3 different malt balls, chocolate covered raisins, chips, string cheese, bottled water, yogurt and amazingly enough single serving size of Haagen Das ice cream....all available 24 hours. Also had free continental breakfast daily. They also have a free shuttle which one can take to the light rail station, which we did, to save you to the drive to downtown Seattle. Thoroughly enjoyed our week long stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Marymarcia
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and lovely rooms. We will be back. I wish I had an event to plan for this location. It is perfect for one location weddings with plenty of space and a nice location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: DanaAllison1961
Reviews.Content: If you ever have the opportunity to stay at this hotel, do it! The rooms are very comfortable. The atmosphere is very relaxed. You would never know the place is located next to the airport with all the greenery. I felt like I was staying at one of Disneyworld's high end resorts. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The snacks in living room area were icy on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Ktravels07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 times in the last month. Loved every minute of it! Service is exceptional! Food outstanding! and who can ever beat free Hagen Daas! Got to love it! Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best lodging we've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: jdubbs
Reviews.Content: The Lodge and grounds are beautiful with plenty of space to spread out, walk, relax, and feel comfortable. We were particularly attracted by the complimentary substantial breakfast, free parking, and wireless internet. The fitness facility is magnificent - a small gym - with many cardio machines and fitness machines - the best I've seen in a lodging. The food at dinner in the Lodge restaurant is excellent. The light rail station is only about a mile away, and the hotel shuttle will take you there and back. Even though it takes almost an hour to get into Seattle city center, the pleasure of staying at Cedarbrook makes it well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “he most amazing hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: llmeyer_50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cedarbrook Lodge after coming back from an amazing Alaskan cruise. The grounds are refreshing and relaxing; the rooms are so comfortable - premium beds and bedding, floor-to-ceiling windows that open; and state-of-the-art bathroom fixtures with a large tub and shower. Beyond the rooms, there is a refreshment and rec center that is reminiscent of a personal home, complete with a stocked freezer of Ben and Jerry's ice cream, yogurt, bottled water, and string cheese in the fridge.. Within the main lobby, there is an open air gourmet restaurant - and the best small bar/library that serves from the restaurant. The whole Lodge used to be the Executive Private Lodge for Washington Mutual Executives...so every aspect is si,ple amazing and top notch..and affordable..we would travel from San Diego to this Lodge as a primary destination...Do yourself a favor and stay here when you are in Seattle...nothing compares!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nbrooks
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Considering it's proximity to the airport it is quiet. The grounds are beautiful. Continental breakfast is included as are snacks available in a common area.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shar831
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel taken care of in a royal fashion, this is the place to come. Gorgeous setting,wonderful service, and gourmet food. What a delight! From check-in to check-out the staff is friendly and so accomodating. Rooms are comfortable and common spaces, including lounges(with snack food provided) are terrific. Setting is truly beautiful with lush vegetation. We went with 3 generations of family and everyone was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: guitargalMaryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the airport. But unlike any other airport hotel I have ever stayed at, this one is absolutely first class. The grounds make you feel like you are at a retreat (except for the planes overhead!). The rooms are understated and elegant, the bathrooms are large and the toiletries are top tier. They provide free snack in a well appointed common "living-room". The staff is extremely helpful and the service is prompt. And the restaurant is definitely a destination restaurant, worth traveling just to come to it. Excellent, inventive food, great local wine pairings, and attentive, unobtrusive service. And all the food is locally sourced, and I think organic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the moment we walked through the front door!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne L
Reviews.Content: Loved it the moment we walked through the front door! Friendly staff, beautiful ambience, and a wonderful restaurant! The best part was the outdoor seating areas to enjoy a drink while taking in all the natural beauty!! Little piece of heaven tucked inside the city!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: h2ogirln2travel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but certainly not a 5 star property. It's at best a 3.5. Location near airport but in a residential area. Not the best area for safety. Property well kept and people were kind but the location and amenties leave much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: I just had to try this hotel after seeing that Trip Advisor contributors ranked it 17th best IN THE WORLD. That would be pretty fantastic, if true... especially at what I consider to be reasonable rates. Nothing against Cedarbrook Lodge, but there's no way it's in the top 20 in the world. (Probably more of a flaw with the Trip Advisor rating system than the hotel.) The hotel is certainly unique... definitely not your run of the mill chain. It has a nice rustic, northwest motif. As others have pointed out, Cedarbrook Lodge has lots of unusual amenities like 24/7 malted milk balls, chips, ice cream, etc., in the lobby area of each building (to go along with comfortable chairs, a fireplace, and a flat screen TV.) The grounds are nicely maintained and they have a gourmet restaurant where I enjoyed a very pleasant dinner outside on the patio (the pan seared halibut was excellent). Peter, my waiter, was attentive and friendly, even though I was a lone diner in the midst of several other busier tables. One problem... after ordering dessert, the maitre d' reported back that the chef would be unable to prepare it (the coconut sorbet) unless I could wait 30 minutes or so. I probably didn't need it anyway. Here's what Cedarbrook Lodge would need to do to get in my top tier: have a bellman meet me at the front door and offer to help with luggage. The first people I encountered were behind the front desk (and it was only 6:30 PM or so). The front desk clerks need to smile and be friendlier. The young man was friendly enough, but I felt like I was imposing on the young woman. Maybe they were trainees??? The early morning front desk clerk (and shuttle driver) was fine... competent and friendly. Ice for the rooms is provided in plastic bags in a freezer in the lobby, but unfortunately, each bag was frozen in a hard chunk, and I didn't think the people downstairs would appreciate me breaking it apart on their ceiling! Some of the wood surfaces in the rooms are starting to show their age - water marks, etc. In my opinion Cedarbrook Lodge is OK... perhaps very good... just not a five star hotel (or in the top twenty worldwide).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LMarieF
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Cedarbrook Lodge and wish all hotels could be as warm and welcoming. Obviously this independent hotel can teach the chains a thing or two about quality. The grounds were immaculate, the rooms and common areas in perfect condition and spotless. We loved the communal kitchen/living room concept with free water, snacks and ice cream and the complimentary breakfast was top quality. We had no issues with the shuttle bus from the airport and the driver was friendly and pleasant. The only thing that would have helped was a better description of the hotel and services from the front desk clerk when we checked in. Overall a wonderful experience and we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect airport hotel?”
Reviews.Author: RichBuckinghamshire
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service, big comfortable rooms, leafy location, great food....and all incredibly a 5' shuttle ride from the airport. Highly recommended for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I have stayed, period! Top notch all the way around. Only draw back is the facility is not near downtown, but the light rail is just around the corner and the hotel shuttle takes you there and the hotel shuttle is very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mammut3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night right after our wedding before flying out for our honeymoon. The bad experience started at check in. We arrived in a limo in a tux and my bride in her wedding dress. The front desk did not acknowledge us nor ask if we needed any help with our luggage. After approaching the counter the gentleman was courteous and checked us in. We proceeded to check in however no bell hop was available so we proceeded to push the luggage cart to the other end of the property to our room. The room: We booked s suite through AAA. Overall the room was nice but there was tons of wasted space. The extra room did big add any usable space at all and from looking into the regular rooms they were a much better value and we liked them more. Room service: Food was pretty standard. Ordered a crab sandwich and the bread was soggy. My new wife ordered a chicken sandwhich and it was very good. The fire alarm: We were awoken at 3 am by the fire alarm going off in our building. Staff was clueless and totally unavailable. The fire trucks showed up and they proceeded to search the building with no fire found. The next issue was the alarm. The fire men were unable to disable it fully but they disabled the alarm sound at approx 4:15. The blinking stove light in our room however proceeded to blink every second until approx 6 am. At no time during this ordeal was any staff member available for questions nor did they let us know what was going on. After having a horrible nights stay we asked for a late checkout so we could catch up after thd fire alarm issue for 3 hours thd night before rudely we were told there was no late checkout by the front desk. I the pressed thd issue further and the manager begrudgingly allowed us to stay an additional hour. Overall there are nice amenities, the breakfast is amazing zng the Lou ge with snacks is a nice treat. It however does not make up for the lack of service we met at every turn. Based on the other reviews I hope our experience was just an anomaly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome just like everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: Well this facility certainly lived up to its reputation. We stayed one night and then another night four days later. My children and I were thrilled with the accommodation and would not hesitate to go back again. The staff were attentive and pleasant. The grounds were well-maintained and attractive. It felt like a little oasis. The main building looked like a museum. The rooms were perfect. They are obviously new and well appointed. The finishings were top-notch. There was nothing in the room that didn't impress us. The room was spacious and had all the little extras you would expect from a facility of this caliber. People have mentioned the lounge. When you're traveling it is the little perks like this that make you remember a hotel. The children were thrilled with the little snacks that they could tide themselves over until the dinner hour. I would echo sentiments of a previous reviewer that it is very hard to open an orange without silverware. They might want to think of another healthy snack such as apples. The continental breakfast was great as well. There was a variety of choices and they can't really complain about anything. We arrived shortly before the breakfast would have been over and there was no lack of choice. We had as much to choose from as they would have had earlier. I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Seattle!!”
Reviews.Author: kathleenma
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place to stay in Seattle--this was our second time to stay here--it's just a beautiful setting and the lodge is just amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we allowed more time to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Jimg0
Reviews.Content: Simply very good, nice extra values. ( free water, ice cream, and yogurt)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Jhalkias
Reviews.Content: This was a short stay on the way to Vancouver, but the property was beautiful, well maintained, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Got to be the best airport area hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteVa
Reviews.Content: Selected this from Tripadvisor and it was spot on. Beautiful grounds, bottled water, snacks and ice cream made our stay delightful.Free continental breakfast too. Now for the BEST...Copperleaf Restaurant where we had the best meal of our two week trip. This is a farm to market restaurant not to be missed. The halibut with local veggies plus a polenta was exquisite. We paired this with a Washington State pino gris for a perfect meal. Sure beats the airport Marriot or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Sea-Tac suburbia!”
Reviews.Author: shelandi
Reviews.Content: I was in town for work and was going both to Seattle and Bellevue so I wanted to stay near the airport so I could drive up either side thus avoiding bridge traffic. This turned out to be a great idea. So glad I choose the Cedarbrook Lodge. To find their lovely hotel campus with gourmet cuisine and free ice cream in the middle of a suburban neighborhood was quite a surprise. As far as I am concerned, there are no other hotels in Seattle to consider. The bed was super comfortable, customer service - amazing and the atmosphere resort-like. I was within 3 miles of the airport so super convenient. I was surprised that I did not hear airport noise being that close. The landscaping was so relaxing with a pond and several waterfalls. I found myself sitting outside quite a bit. Only drawback - their wireless service was terrible. I used their FREE business center, which was nice and included a printer, but could not do that in my pajamas.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, relaxing, beautiful~”
Reviews.Author: Sharley F
Reviews.Content: It is a very beautiful place~landscape, architecture & service wonderful. Very close to the airport but feel like your out in the mountains! I will definitely stay there on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook Lodge has a simple elegance and beautiful arboretum like grounds.”
Reviews.Author: 58thway
Reviews.Content: I would love to give Cedarbrook a excellent rating but there were a few hiccups on our stay with them. First impressions are the most important so as we stood at the front desk to check in we were shocked that the person on the front desk left us standing there without even acknowledging our prensence. Everyone else who we interacted with on our stay did everything they could to make sure we were happy. Then there was the housekeeping issue on one of the days, where our bathroom was only half cleaned. Dirty towels left and no coffee pod for the coffeemaker. On the postive side we looked forward to going down to breakfast every morning and after a couple of days it felt like home. Loved the free water bottles, chips, ice cream and candy. You are doing all the right things to rise above the chains and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would recommend this to all”
Reviews.Author: Tmac0810Baltimore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a unique experience. We loved the room and the whole facility. On our last night we had dinner there at the hotel. The food and the presentation of the food was just outstanding. My husband and I loved the food experience. The flavors that were infused on each plate were off the charts. I told our waitor to please extend our appreciate to the Chef, it was amazing quisine. I would highly recommend this hotel and the restuarant and will definitly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: IsleofWightPoshbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to and back from our Alaskan adventure and we needed to be close to the airport. The free and quick transfer service was great. Our welcome was excellent and the facilities were well thought through and worked well. We particularly liked the guest lounges in each lodge, with fridges full of water, yoghurt and ice cream for guests to use and comfy spaces to mix with other guests . The grounds were beautiful and hosted lots of weddings. We ate in the bar which had a pool table and friendly staff. The gym looked good but didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TarHeel
Reviews.Content: Very well-kept hotel close to SeaTac airport. Shuttles to the light rail station meant we only used our rental car once. Pleasant grounds with trees and garden in a residential setting (seriously, it looks like the hotel sits right next to ranch-style homes from the 1970s). Was there for a mini-reunion and someone commented on how comfortable the robes were. Next night everyone in our party was lounging in robes out back on the patio (it was a bit chilly and they even had a fire going in the outdoor fireplace). Snacks were a big bonus but it would have been great to have coffee as well. I know there's coffee in the rooms but you have to make it a pot at a time. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise as well. I'm usually not a fan of oatmeal but this rendition plus all the toppings was very good. Double bonus for the wonderful smoked salmon. Again, what would have taken breakfast over the top is another hot option like sausage, bacon, eggs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful property marred by numerous electronic failings”
Reviews.Author: BriarClubCommish
Reviews.Content: Hundreds of other reviews can tell you how peaceful and serene this property is. No need for me to repeat them. Instead, here is how our week's vacation was inconvenienced by the hotel's numerous electronic failures. 1. The key card system is flawed. My wife and I had to get our room keys reprogrammed every day for 5 days. And yes, we each kept them away from cell phones, other credit cards, etc. Not a big deal? Yes it is when entry to any building, fitness center, guest room, etc. is locked. 2. Internet in the rooms is spotty. Sometimes it is lightening fast, sometimes it simply stops. Is somebody stealing bandwidth from them at various times of the day? 3. The men's room in the main building, near where breakfast is served, has three "hands free" sinks/faucets. Two do not work. The sensors have gone bad. 4. The fitness center has two LifeCycle ellipticals. One works great, the other's software is inoperable. It probably just needs to be rebooted. 5. Nothing says "we're old, tired and cheap" like dated Panasonic tube televisions in the guest rooms. You get the picture. It is an oasis where everything is not quite right. The free Haagen Dazs is great but the daily continental breakfast never changes. OK for a 1 or 2 day meeting; tedious if you stay a week.

Reviews.Title: “An airport oasis”
Reviews.Author: Zoysiaplug
Reviews.Content: Fabulous northwest lodge feel in a secluded airport neighborhood. Had dinner in the lounge. Bryce provided exceptional service and great humor. This is a special spot, I really mean it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: Sandy H
Reviews.Content: The serenity and beauty of a natural wetlands environment and the easy access to fast and reliable transportation into the heart of bustling downtown Seattle made our stay perfect. The lodge's grounds are absolutely beautiful as well as the interior decoration of all areas with some really beautiful original art pieces The art glass pieces in the restaurant were especially memorable. The complimentary shuttle service to and from the nearby Lite Rail Station made all of our tourist trips to the city so easy. And we always had the Lodge to come back to to relax and refresh for the next day. The service was impeccable from every single staff person from the housekeeping manager to the restaurant manager and front desk staff. The amenities were extraordinary. From the complimentary continental breakfast (you must try the oatmeal with all the fixings!) to the snack-stocked living room area for each lodge (complimentary Haagen Daz ice cream, string cheese, fruit, bottled water and more!) Be sure and try the onsite restaurant at least once, the Copperleaf. The local and sustainable items on the menu are varied and everything we tried was delicious. We would not consider staying anywhere else if we go back to the Seattle area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property with good staff”
Reviews.Author: Insman
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport but with no noise. Shuttle service and continental breakfast, including lox and bagels, were great.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ViningsTimbo
Reviews.Content: From the swift airport pick-up, to check-in, to gorgeous facility and rooms, to excellent cuisine, Cedarbrook has it all. Tucked away in a quiet neighborhood, this is a beautiful, earth-friendly property, with warm personnel to match its warm, cozy interior and immaculate, stunning grounds. The rooms are wonderfully appointed. The wing's central gathering room offers free water, chips and many flavored malted milk balls. The next time our plans call for a stay in the Sea-Tac area, we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to start a trip”
Reviews.Author: sofiegsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cedarbrook before a recent vacation as our plane left from SeaTac airport at 5am and staying near the airport was our best option. What a great place! They have a free airport shuttle available 24 hours a day and even have coffee waiting for you in the wee morning hours. The restaurant ond pub are terrific, the place is spotless and the free amenities are impressive. The communal living areas had everything you could need- bottled water, ice cream, yougurt, cheese etc. There are walking trails, beautiful grounds and a resort like atmosphere all at a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “One of best we've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Jack654321
Reviews.Content: I've never been moved to write a hotel review until now. We were blown away by this facility. Although near the airport, it seemed like a quiet oasis with beautiful grounds set among a border of trees. The rooms were quiet, spacious, modern, well equipped, well kept up and very comfortable. The floor living room was a very nice plus. The meals served in the restaurant and the service there were outstanding. The shuttle service to the airport and light rail was timely. The staff were friendly and helpful. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay there again when we visit Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Community room!”
Reviews.Author: UplandMom
Reviews.Content: Our family all met up and stayed here before our Family Reunion Cruise. It was so nice to have the community room to congregrate in and plan our day. And having the snacks on hand was WONDERFUL! Having the shuttle available was great. Our group was comprised of children, senior citizens,and this place was perfect for our accommodations. I can't wait to return to Seattle, to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy225
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to airport yet quiet. Awesome customer service. The restaurant was good we ate there several times during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel8811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was very comfortable and super clean with no problems. Excellent "healthy"complimentary breakfast was a great treat. The staff were nice and professional people. In my opinion this hotel should be rated higher. You don't need to think twice before booking this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanK58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cedarbrook Lodge for one night on a layover from Maui. We had a wonderful time, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the hotel is beautiful, and the rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed. We enjoyed the restaurant for lunch before our shuttle to the airport, we sat outside on the beautiful patio in the sun, it was wonderful. We will definitely recommend Cedarbrook Lodge to anyone staying in the Seattle area and would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “It met the standards set by all of the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: rga777
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there for a few days in July 2011 at the end of a couple week trip. Depending on the reason for the visit, we would definitely stay again. The hotel is very close to the airport but the other reviewers are spot-on; you do not realize how close you are to the airport when you on the property. The rooms are huge! There is plenty of storage for a lot of luggage. It is quiet and relaxing. The little touches such as free ice cream, water, snacks, string cheese, etc. are really cool and were a hit with the family. The free shuttle service takes you to and from the airport or light rail promptly. Breakfast is good and the restaurant is excellent but a little pricey. The staff was also very pleasant. If I need to travel to the Seattle airport area or plan to divide time between Seattle, Tacoma, and Olympia, this would be the only place I would stay. On the other hand, if I was planning to be in downtown Seattle for the entire trip I would likely stay somewhere more convenient despite the fact this would be a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but would not recommend for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: replay49
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted a small (11 person) 6 hour business meeting here. The facility is beautiful and well appointed, but the staff does not appear to be geared to handle business meetings, either that or they just subscribe to poor customer service, I donâ€™t know which. The package we purchased included continental breakfast, box lunch, and afternoon snack as well as coffee and soda throughout the meeting. The cost per person, including their mandatory 21% â€œservice chargeâ€�, was $101.64 before taxes. When we arrived in the room, there was, as planned, coffee and tea, plus a tray of cold bagels a small batch of muffins about the size of a mini-cupcake as well as a bowl of apples, oranges and pears. The fruit was not sliced nor were there utensils provided. There was no way to toast the bagels, however there were small packets of cream cheese. This is what they advertised as a continental breakfast. After our meeting started, so did the gardeners outside the room. For a good part of the morning portion of the meeting, we were competing with a gardener who had a complete arsenal of power tools, including a mower, edger, and blower. There was no apparent consideration for keeping the noise down during our meeting. Lunch was supposed to arrive at Noon, but it was delivered a half hour early, interrupting our meeting. Rather than have the servers disrupt us further, we asked them to leave the box lunches on the carts on which they were brought and we would serve ourselves later. This apparently caused much confusion for the staff, because they took it to mean we wanted no further interruptions and therefore did not deliver the afternoon snack, which was included in the price per person. Not once during our stay did anyone from the sales or catering departments stop by to see if we needed anything. When a couple of days after the meeting we complained about the service, the noise, and the non-existent afternoon break, we were treated in an unprofessional manner, laying the blame on us for not complaining at the time. I should point out that the meeting was in a building quite a ways from the front desk. In order to complain, we would have to leave the meeting, hike to the front desk, wait for someone to speak to from sales or catering, and hike back to the meeting. For the amount of money we spent on this relatively short meeting, we should expect better from a luxury hotel. To add insult to injury, when we finally received a copy of our bill (it had been charged to our credit card) we discovered they overcharged us by $250. It took over one month to receive the refund. So while the facilities are beautiful, and the location convenient, we donâ€™t plan to return anytime soon unless they learn to be more responsive to their corporate clients.

Reviews.Title: “A real joy to stay here”
Reviews.Author: TJM1973
Reviews.Content: We loved it and wi'll be back. Nice shuttle service. Delightful continental breakfast. Lunch was delicious. Every staff member was friendly. I especially enjoyed the complimentary snacks, including water, malt balls, potato chips, cheese sticks, yoghurt, and even ice cream. The deep bath tub is something I would like to have in my house, if I ever remodel. The robes are so nice, so we bought one (but only come in Large). Room had a very large wide-screen LCD TV. I stayed two nights in July 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing oasis close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Janice49
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for the convenience of the SeaTac airport. Rooms are very comfortable and the lodge has some great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and great value”
Reviews.Author: Ycamyw
Reviews.Content: We love the beautiful trees and enjoyed walking around the property. Breakfast items were all high quality, not packaged products. Homemade apple preserves and smoked salmon were the best. The young staff members drove the shuttle bus and were very warm and friendly. Highly recommended as a starting point for Mt Rainier since it is south of Seattle. Much better value than hotels in downtown Seattle, but not so convenient if you want a mid-afternoon rest at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: jaaearl
Reviews.Content: Cedarbrook lodge is the best hotel ever! Service was fantastic! Great large room for a family of 4. Free breakfast each morning, and the complimentary snacks were beyond what we would expect! My kids loved coming back to the hotel and picking out an ice cream, or chips or candy to take back to the room to enjoy! The hotel also drove us to the rail station by the airport to take the train into the city, so we wouldn't have to drive into the city! Then when we were almost back to the same stop coming back, we'd call the hotel and they would have someone right there to pick us up and take us back to hotel! Free! Can not say enough good about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: painter004
Reviews.Content: best hotel i have stayed at in a long time. location was a little hard to find but that may be a good thing. near airport but didn't feel like it. the light rail /shuttle is worth taking and not having to stay downtown. of course the community rooms are great with the free stuff. rooms are quiet and big enough. certainly owrth the money

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the ruff”
Reviews.Author: jerafiks
Reviews.Content: We flew into and out of Seattle, WA from Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Our final destination was Banff, BC and only had 2 days to spare in Seattle. The first day was an overnight before heading north into Canada and the second was on the return, a day before flying back to Fort Lauderdale out of Seattle. I was looking for a hotel that met the "green" aspect I read so much of...which Seattle had to offer. I research hotels in downtown Seattle and found that they were quite mainstream and not unique. That was until Cedarbrook Lodge fell into my lap. I would highly suggest staying here. The calm and peaceful environment was soooo welcoming. The hotel is spotless, and lawns well manicured. My boys were able to see rabbits and other animals on property. Every floor has a common living room where you can help yourself to chocolate covered raisens, pretzels and other candies. Chips, water, cheese, yogart and ice-cream is yours to indulge in. My boys had a field day with the ice-cream! The rooms are beautifully decorated and beds were comfortable. We loved the large soaking tub. The hotel amenities include bath salts for a relaxing bath. Cozy bath robes are also there for your usage. The hotel has its own vegetable garden which supplies their organic restaurant with fresh greens and herbs. Highly recommended! Others wrote in to complain about noise and small rooms and I must say...I beg to differ. The lodge is quiet and serene. The grounds are beautifully appointed and the sound of running water was exactly what we were looking for. Coming from FL this is exactly what we wanted from a hotel out west. I must also let you know about their breakfast. Amazing lox, fresh jams and more. Yummy. We started our vacation at the Cedarbrook Lodge and ended it here before heading back to FL and I would do it again! I highly recommend this hotel. I must say one more thing...keep in mind when you book a hotel downtown, you have to pay for parking. They don't tell you that upon booking...just keep that in mind. Sometimes up to $30 a day. No charge for parking here at Cedarbrook! Cedarbrook Lodge was our "green" experience in Seattle we would never forget. Try it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: weezlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Cedarbrook Lodge and I am forever grateful. It is my new place to stay in the Seattle area. It is only a couple of miles from Sea-tac airport but feels like an oasis. The rooms are very comfortable, the complimentary breakfast buffet is gourmet (with smoked salmon!) and there are treats available 24 hours a day in the living rooms in each building (such as haagen daz ice cream). The restaurant is also quite good-reservations are recommended. It's close to the light rail which will take you into downtown Seatlte. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: saumur
Reviews.Content: The gorgeous setting, the huge bathtub, the always-available treats, the soothing architecture and furnishings all contributed to a feeling of being in a 5-star hotel. At first my son and I wondered if we'd made a mistake by staying so far away from downtown, but Cedarbrook was so nice to come home to and offered so many luxuries -- including a restaurant with some of the best food I've ever tasted -- that we decided that this is THE place to stay for us when in Seattle. The light rail made the trip downtown and back easy. And the shuttle is always available.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night en route to Mt. Rainier National Park. We wished we had scheduled more activities in Seattle just so we could have stayed a second night. I won't repeat what has already been said in other positive reviews, but will confirm that this is a wonderful hotel, a beautiful property, with rooms and perks well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “More like a great retreat center than a five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jujubean45
Reviews.Content: I went to Seattle for the weekend with my husband and 6-month old to attend a friend's wedding. Like everyone else, I read the glowing reviews and had to see for myself. We liked it but it reminded us more of the rustic retreat centers that churches hold their annual retreats - no frills, spartan bathrooms, a full fridge down the hall. So if you want luxury and style, this place isn't for you. What we didn't like was the fact that we had to call Housekeeping twice after our bathroom backed up, and then when they arrived, WE had to take care of it ourselves. Now we've gotten our hands dirty before (a 6-month old assures us of that) but we weren't expecting this from the best hotel on Tripadvisor. Oh well, minus one star. Overall, good but not fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Zfamiily
Reviews.Content: Read several great reviews on TripAdvisor and wanted to try this out during our summer road trip. Really amazing hotel. Fantastic breakfast, and great 24/7 snacks in the building living room. Very comfortable, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Grounds were beautiful and the kids really enjoyed the gym. And of course, the snacks in the common room - Haagen Daaz, milk balls, string cheese, bottled waters, chocolate pretzels. We want to finagle a way to visit Seattle again soon just to go back to Cedarbrook! (only sort of kidding on the last one...)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: AHAMMONS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, Quiet, and Comfortable and SUPER CLEAN... Free chocolates, hagen daas ice cream, and other snacks. LOVELY complimentary breaksfast including bagels, other breads, smoked salmon, an oatmeal bar, eggs, fruit, juices, tea and coffee, and more. incredible.... the restaurant is a little "foo-foo" for me - especially if you have kids - eat somewhere else and same a little money and actually get full, ha-ha. But, just BEAUTIFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DecaturTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Got this for $90 a night via Hotwire and it was a great value. All of the positive reviews were spot on. The only negative was that the hotel was far from downtown especially during weekday traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience! It totally went beyond my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: LLKY
Reviews.Content: Top ten reasons to stay at Cedarbrook Lodge 1. Price 2. Beautiful 3. Award winning 4. Yummy snacks! (ice cream, chips, yougart, chocolate, etc.!) 5. Great location-did not hear one airplane.. 6. Very friendly staff 7. An experience-more than just a place to stay 8. Rooms were big 9. Huge windows in rooms-don't feel "trapped in a box" like most places 10. I was in awe my whole 3 days of how great it was!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fischman44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cedarbrook based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. I was taking a father/son trip and wanted to spend a couple days in Seattle before heading to Olympic National Park. I was a little concerned with staying down by the airport and then having to drive into Seatlle each day. My concern was unjustified because Cedarbrook had a nice driver that took us on the short drive to the linkrail. It was only $2.75 and dropped us off in the middle of Seattle. Very convenient and much cheaper than driving. The hotel has great service, very nice rooms, and all the amenities you would expect based on the reviews I read here. Every one I asked for help went above and beyond. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cedarbrook Lodge is enchanting. Will recommend it widely.”
Reviews.Author: Bill32849
Reviews.Content: Truly a special place to get away from hectic modern life, without having to drive a long distance from home. Exceptionally delicious food. Wonderful wine list by the glass. The sheer beauty of the surroundings, both inside, and outside, will not be forgotten anytime soon. If you need to catch up on sleep, the beds are sublime.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! WHAT, WHAT?!”
Reviews.Author: Liscorey
Reviews.Content: This place was great, can't wait to stay again. Beautiful setting (in the midst of SeaTac, who knew?), great service, awesome bar with pool table and very fun staff! Just took the light rail to DT Seattle, was perfect weekend! Need I mention the free water, cheese, yogurt, and ICE CREAM!!!!!! LOVED IT! Breakfast was SPECTACULAR, as well.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Cstrozyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group and had SO much fun! It is a beautiful Lodge with clean rooms, a great tub/shower, and very comfortable beds. The living rooms provide a place to gather and lots of free snacks! The breakfast was wonderful. We spent a lot of time playing pool in the bar, where we had the most joyful staff serving us and interacting with us. Our shuttle service was prompt and pleasant and it was just an overall WONDERFUL stay! We stay in Seattle every few months, and this will now be our ONLY choice. What a fun time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but certainly not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zigzagg
Reviews.Content: We have a suite. One of the best hotels in the country, or even Seattle? Not even close. No frig in the unit (down the hall), the carpet is kind of falling apart, furniture is OK, the bed is a Murphy bed. Tube TV in 2011? No pool. Nice grounds and the windows open, no screens though. I peeked in one of the standard rooms, small and not well appointed. The WiFi doesn't work. They will give a big cord though. It is a tranquil place near the airport in Seattle. Not a bad price. Not great.

Reviews.Title: “Restful, exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lalama
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels for a 2 night stay after a cruise, and an earlier 4 night stay in downtown Seattle, I was very interested in booking this hotel. I hesitated, though, because the price was more than we wanted to spend. We tentatively booked another hotel, then I kept watch for a price drop. The price available online didn't drop, but using my guess based on info found on betterbidding.com, I got the Cedarbrook Lodge for a great price (and did a late-night happy dance). When we arrived, we were impressed with the feeling of seclusion...we'd read it, but didn't know what to expect. One of my daughters commented that it looked like a Disney lodge- a high compliment. :-) The room was huge, had a fantastic soaking tub, big floor to ceiling windows, TONS of drawer and closet space, comfy robes, and great beds. The perks at this hotel exceeded any we've experienced in the past- "living rooms" stocked with bottled water, Haagen-Dazs ice cream, and snacks, and great breakfast in the morning- all complimentary. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, and think the actual price is justified. This is a fantastic place to get away from the big city for a restful break. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, I LOVE this place.”
Reviews.Author: grapewizard
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 2215. Needed to be close to the airport and out at 5am. I expected the typical airport hotel feel. Boy, was I wrong. This place ROCKS! It's like staying at a 5 star high end lodge in a peaceful, tranquil setting. No lack of amenities. And the restaurant, wine list, food menu, bar, etc. were all a 10...... KUDOS to you. You nailed it......

Reviews.Title: “Restful”
Reviews.Author: TMK19
Reviews.Content: Great rooms away from the usual airport hustle & bustle. Free WiFi spotty

Reviews.Title: “Affordable lodging with high-end amenities”
Reviews.Author: Travelingismyh0bby
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Cedarbrook Lodge based on reviews at TA, and the place definitely did not dissapoint!! The first time my husband and I arrived at Cedarbrook Lodge, we both said, "WOW!!!" Though it is so close to Sea-Tac airport and I-5, this quiet, dreamy lodging takes you away from hustle and bustle of Seattle. Due to its location within residential area, it is better to rent a car (plus GPS) than relying on the hotel shuttle to go around the city. Don't worry, the parking is free of charge. Our room was spacious for 2 people with floor-to-ceiling window overlooking the backyard. Complimentary Starbucks house blend and Tazo teabag were nice touch. My husband was impressed by how fast the hotel's free high speed internet was. Every lodge has living rooms where free flows of fresh fruits, chocolate malt balls, chips, cheese sticks, yogurts, bottled water, and Haagen-Dazs ice cream singles are provided. My hubby and I even made time to watch TV and to read some books there. The hotel's Northwest continental breakfast was delicious, but we wished there were more food selection. My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in Cedarbrook and spent most of our time driving around Seattle. We wish we had more time to explore the lodge. We would certainly choose to stay in Cedarbrook Lodge again the next time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: russell78
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Everything about our stay was wonderful, the room, the restaurant, the"Living Room" and staff!!! We can't wait to come back to Seattle just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty - but had to check out after way less than a day!”
Reviews.Author: anabana
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February with my 7 year old after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. While the room was pretty, there was some sort of problem with the vent system and the room smelled like the inside of a fireplace. Switched to another room after a couple of hours and had the same problem. Was offerred to switch to another room in the morning but we switched to the Fairmont where we had no issues. I do however have to praise the staff at the hotel! My son became sick on the flight to Seattle and had a fever when we checked into the hotel. One of the staff members whose shift was ending was kind enough to go to the drugstore for me to buy a thermometer and gatorade for him. It was really appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: NETraveler2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cedarbrook Lodge for the first 3 nights of our vacation and tour down to San Francisco via some of the Northwest National Parks. The hotel was great - all we expected it to be - not disappointed at all. It has a great location close to the airport (although you'd never know, being secluded in almost a nature reserve); the shuttle to the airport and the Seattle transit were great; the free snacks, fruit and ice cream in the communal areas were really welcome; and the breakfast, if a little limited, was included and great quality. My only slight complaint was the price of the restaurant/bar menu - very pricey. Otherwise we had a great time and would definitely recommend / return!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds and beautiful locations and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Qwackertoo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Will recommend to all friends visiting Seattle for business and pre & post cruise stays. The room was beautifully appointed and the very long desk area, the two closets, the very large and nicely tiled shower area and bath counters. Definitely five stars for a hotel in this price range and very comfortable. The shuttle service and driver to the airport was very courteous and helpful with all our luggage. The kids loved the H-D ice cream treats too, nice touch~!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Janet918
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we had read about in other folks' reviews. Even though it was just minutes away from SeaTac Airport, it felt like it was miles from there - very quiet and beautiful natural surroundings. It looks exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. Everything was spotlessly clean and beautiful. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - especially loved the free shuttle service to the light rail station. The complimentary breakfast buffet each morning was stellar - best oatmeal I've ever eaten! Computers were available for our use in the Business Center, the free snacks in the living rooms were the best, and the restaurant and bar outstanding - the chef even grows his own herbs on the property! We would defintely stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone going to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time to enjoy this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoLovesSummer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern and included some great perks. Our favorite was the living room that included complimentary access to a variety of treats - including ice cream :) We had friends with a 9 month old stop by to visit and it was wonderful to have access to the common space.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had a reason to go back!”
Reviews.Author: meredith022
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, near the airport, for 1 night, purely for the convenience, and based on the TA reviews. It was the single best hotel we stayed in for our entire trip. This was 5 star all the way, at 3 star prices - particularly when you did the discount pay in advance! The rooms were large and beautifully appointed, the linen so fine even the hubby commented! and the bathrooms were stunning. The overall location and gardens were very pleasant, and the whole lodge feel beautifully done. We arrived late, and ordered from the bar menu - and had the best and most upmarket hamburger we've ever had. In contrast, breakfast food was pretty boring and ordinary - but a small quibble, in an overall excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, nice room and free snacks!”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryBoy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our experience here, our room was decent sized, the bathroom was fantastic and the grounds were beautiful. These things alone would probably warrant a five star review and the "living room" stocked with free snacks was just icing on the cake. I have read through the reviews and though most people love this place I've noticed that a big problem for those who don't is the location and I would like to touch on this. We were on our way South on a road trip, this hotel felt very remote and I would have never seen it driving along the interstate and yet it's less than five minutes off the Interstate. As much as I loved this hotel I can't imagine staying here without a car, it's only a ten or 15 minute drive to downtown and the parking is free so it's a great base for touring Seattle by vehicle but I wouldn't try relying on their shuttle and transit it's simply too remote a location. Now that I've gotten that out of the way let's move on to the good stuff: As I mentioned the location is gorgeous. The hotel is located next to extensive wooded wetlands and they have some short paths you can stroll along as well as some pretty ponds. Our room had a nice view of the wetlands, two queen beds and a really comfortable full size chair and ottoman. The bathroom had a soaker tub and a separate shower which was really nice not to mention really comfy bathrobes. A short elevator ride was the common area they call the living room there was a fridge stocked with bottled water, yogurt and cheese strings and a freezer full of individual Hagen Daz Ice creams. There was also fresh fruit, potato chips and the yummiest malt balls on offer. This was a unique and much appreciated amenity, it was like having a mini bar without the ridiculous prices, or any price did I mention it was all free? Breakfast was not extensive but was high quality and tasty. There was homemade granola, bagels with smoked salmon and a few other items I don't recall it too was included in the price of the room. We didn't have drinks in the lounge or eat dinner in the restaurant but both looked pleasant and we probably would have it we weren't traveling with our kids. If you don't mind the slightly off the beaten path location this is a fabulous spot!

Reviews.Title: “Done it will not return”
Reviews.Author: suealways
Reviews.Content: After reading glowing reviews here we decided to stay here before and after our cruise. Service was less than expected for price paid. Our first night there was no ice cream to be found in any of the buildings and staff told us they were "out" of ice cream. Our second day/night was even worse service. We were dropped off to catch the rail to downtown. When we arrived back for pick-up -- no one answered the phone at the lodge. After numerous unanswered calls we walked over to the airport to use the curtesy phone there and again no one answered the phone at the lodge on numerous tries. We were tired, wet, and cold and needed to go back to the lodge. We finally found the number to the restuarant and they answered. They let the front desk know to come and get us. When we arrived back at the lodge I told my story to the girl at the front desk who did not show any empathy for our ordeal. I asked to speak to the manager only to be told the manager was not available. I asked if she knew the phone was not working, she said yes she did her manager called her on cell to let her know. I asked if they kept a log of customers left at the rail and she said yes. I asked if she did not think it appropriate to call us on cell as her manager had called her. No appoligies offered no concern shown -- no the service expected for price paid. The rooms were nice and the bathtub was wonderful. The grounds were nice and peaceful. The restuaurant food was decent and yes expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved the complimentary snacks and the beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: 2011bill
Reviews.Content: Got a good price on Cedarbrook off of Hotwire. Usually stay at Super 8. This is a very nice place to stay. They have complimentary snacks 24hrs a day: yogurt, cheese sticks, ice cream, etc. 8 yr old loved walking around the grounds of the Lodge, very pretty. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Service was with a smile and staff helped solve a couple problems we had--very flexible. My guess is the staff has the go ahead to do what they need to do to help customers out. Shuttle to airport was on time and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicky14
Reviews.Content: Oh gosh....where do I start. First, this hotel is in a residential neighborhood, which may seem strange, but it made it feel part of the community that enveloped it. It was tranquil, serene, quiet and the staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was very quiet, and very well appointed. Even in the morning when housekeeping was cleaning other rooms, and people were leaving the complex, we were able to sleep in a little, and woke up when we wanted to rather than being woken up by others in the hallways. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and seemed to care about us and our needs. The meal in the main "restaurant" was delicious, though we would have liked a little more to choose from on the menu. We don't eat rabbit or veal, and these were two options, but I had the halibut and it melted in your mouth. The prices in the restaurant were a little high, we thought, but the attention we received and the presentation of the food was perfect. The shuttle to the airport was great and less than a fifteen minute ride, but because of the gardens surrounding the hotel, we feel like we were miles away... I would highly recommend this place. We truly "loved it."

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but didn't think it was the best place we've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jcrdaycare
Reviews.Content: After all the rave reviews, we thought it was going to be more special than it was. The room and bed were small, but it was picturesque, and very quiet for being so close to the airport. The staff was very nice and the shuttle was quick and efficient to the light rail system. The free snacks were a nice touch. Lunch was very good. No complaints except we didn't like the pillows which made for a rough first night. Nice bathroom. Free internet was also nice. There is free parking if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mariusos
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Nice staff, and the accomadation is pretty good. Rooms are big and nice. The restaurant serves good food. Plus for having fridges stacked with complimentary ice cream and water. It's a real value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: RunningNana
Reviews.Content: I had booked my 4night stay quite awhile ago and was not disappointed. We had stayed in a very nice hotel downtown Seattle and moved here to complete our vacation. We did have a car and our plane was to visit the National Parks. I loved the location. We did not use the restaurants just because we were gone all day. I loved the snacks and ice cream. The mint malted milk balls were a favorite. You are close to the interstate, light link and airport. Staff very helpful. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: NoelZ25
Reviews.Content: The Cedarbrook Lodge is opulent. It is so tranquil and relaxing that is hard to believe that the Cedarbrook is so close the airport. The staff is excellent and Chris, the manager on duty during our stay made our weekend vacation even better. His charm and attention to detail were great. We recommend the Cedarbrook and can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but seriously over-hyped.”
Reviews.Author: szpal
Reviews.Content: We checked out of a fabulous downtown hotel a day early just so we could stay at Cedarbrook Lodge. After reading all the glowing reviews, I was expecting something truly extraordinary. And was........quite surprised and a little disappointed. Here are the good points: Close to airport, tucked away in a residential neighborhood. Gorgeous, restful environment Free snacks Nice staff I didn't use it but the Fitness Center looked very nice. Now for the negatives: We dropped our rental car off at the airport and called for a shuttle ride from the airport kiosk. The call just kept going to voice mail. "We're sorry to have missed your call. Please leave a message." After deciding this wasn't a fluke and, indeed, there was no one answering the phone that day, I called the reservation number. We stayed on hold with her for about 10 minutes while she tried to call. Same answer. Or should I say, Same No Answer. Finally she advised us to walk down to the next island and try from there. Not sure why a different person would be manning the phone for each island, but it worked--we got to talk to a live person and requested a ride for 5 people. Our ride arrived within about 25 minutes. It was the hotel car (not a shuttle) and wasn't big enough for the 5 of us. Our five year old sat on a lap. I thought it was odd that a high rated "airport hotel" that advertises an airport shuttle, didn't seem to have their act together in this area. The rooms were beautiful but not very practical. The light was dim, not good for people who like to read at night. The tv was small and, surprisingly, not a flat screen. It was tucked away in a cabinet, on a swivel base, and seemed like an after-thought. There was no table in the room so room service had to be eaten at the desk. High points for aesthetics, low marks for usability. No pool. At this price point and with the beautiful grounds, our family was very surprised that there wasn't a pool. Indeed, there's not a lot here at all for families to do if you don't have a car. Except snack. The restaurant on-site is very expensive and the seating extremely limited (13 tables total). My husband and I enjoyed our meal there, but to take an entire family to dinner would cost a small fortune.
